BUILD FAILED in 2m 55s 29 actionable tasks: 29 executed Command failed with exit code 1: /home/moodle/Moodle_Mobile_Dev_Environment/projects/moodleapp/platforms/android/gradlew cdvBuildDebug -b /home/moodle/Moodle_Mobile_Dev_Environment/projects/moodleapp/platforms/android/build.gradle ───────────────────────────────────────────────── Ionic CLI update available: 6.19.0 → 6.20.4 Run npm i -g @ionic/cli to update ───────────────────────────────────────────────── [ERROR] An error occurred while running subprocess cordova. cordova build android exited with exit code 1. Thanks in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to take build
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there, For these types of errors I suggest that you take a look at the General Advice section in the troubleshooting guide, most of the issues can be fixed doing something from that list. Other than that, seeing that you're having issue with the Android build, make sure that you have all the Android dependencies installed. For example, if it was working in 4.0.1 but doesn't work for 4.1-dev it's possible that it's related with MOBILE-4123 , where we updated the targetSdk to API level 31. Maybe you need to download the Android libraries for this API level.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to take build
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Thank you for your response. Which Android libraries do I need to install? So far I have already installed SDK Platforms for API Levels 30, 31, 32, and 33 and SDK Build Tools 30.0.3, 31.0.0, 32.0.0, and 33.0.1. Also, I have installed and configured the latest Gradle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to take build
ResponsesInList.Text: I think SDK with API level 31 should be enough, so maybe the problem is not related with this. Make sure to follow the rest of the suggestions in the troubleshooting section, and if nothing works it's probably something specific to your environment and maybe it'd be easier to search for Ionic or Cordova troubleshooting instructions.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to take build
ResponsesInList.Text: Ok. Sure I'll search for Ionic or Cordova troubleshooting instructions. Just now I executed the command using the verbose flag for 4.1-dev and in the terminal, I noticed this: > Task :CordovaLib:compileDebugJavaWithJavac An exception has occurred in the compiler (1.8.0_261). Please file a bug against the Java compiler via the Java bug reporting page ( http://bugreport.java.com ) after checking the Bug Database ( http://bugs.java.com ) for duplicates. Include your program and the following diagnostic in your report. Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Problem uploading more than one video on an iPhone
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello - Here's the scenario - I'm trying to upload a video into my private files thru the app on my iPhone (OS 9.3). I record and upload the first one (we'll call it Video A) with no problems. When I try and record/upload another one, Video B, everything looks like it's working properly. I get a " Success! The file was successfully uploaded " notification. However, when I go to my private files, in either the app or Moodle proper, the only video there is Video A. There's no sign of Video B. And Video B doesn't overwrite Video A. Now, to upload a new/different video, I need to remove Video A from My Files in Moodle. On Android devices, this doesn't seem to be an issue. Thanks again for your hard work on the app. Our students are really finding it valuable!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Problem uploading more than one video on an iPhone
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for reporting this Drew, I opened an issue to fix this: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MOBILE-1495 Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Mobile and firewall
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi! My Moodle mobile app is not working, and I don't know why. It was working some time ago, and there were not significant changes on Moodle site accept usual upgrades. But I don't know when app is not working and is says it can't connect server . There are two separate instances of Moodle on server and both are not working, I have other 3 servers and they are working without problems. Only thing that is coming to my mind is that maybe firewall prevents Mobile app to connect to server. Does anybody know what ports must stay open for mobile app to work? Thank you. Ivica

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mobile and firewall
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, the app should connect to the default http and https ports, we don't use any special port. This problem can be caused by certificates. If you use SSL, please use a SSL Checker to verify your certificate is ok: https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mobile and firewall
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, you were right, there was a problem with ssl. Now mobile is working without problems. Ivica

ResponsesInList.Title: Will custom application be upgraded to version 3.7.2?
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hello, Does anyone know if there will be an update application code
to version 3.7.2? https://github.com/moodlehq/moodlemobile2 I mainly mean security patches, described here: https://lists.moodle.org/w/7PO07OJlrulaHiFLo6IAjQ/tq0lNDXhoqeaSOSsRiZOjA/K24sgPNmu4AXgRCkgn6ePQ

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Will custom application be upgraded to version 3.7.2?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, we have a responsible security policy for vulnerabilities disclosure, this means that we won't publish detailed information about the security issue until we are sure that the official and branded apps developed by Moodle HQ are updated. In this case, the vulnerability was reported privately to us by an independent security researcher. So it is not out of the public domain . We expect to publish the patches in two weeks

ResponsesInList.Title: Odp: Re: Will custom application be upgraded to version 3.7.2?
ResponsesInList.Text: OK I understand,

ResponsesInList.Title: Link
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi my installed moodle version is 3.5.2, the app is conected via sso which works fine. if i enter in a moodlle course a link to youtube and watch this in the mobile app this works also fine. now to the problem. I have following link https://mediapool.coffeelinkng.schaerer.com/WMF/VideoHandler.View.php?ID=34008 if I use moodle desktop, in crome and in a second browsertab i'm allready connected to the "Mediapool link" with User and password, then this work fine. if i use the moodle mobile app  and in safari  on ios 12 and in a browsertab i'm allready connected to the "Mediapool link" with User and password, then the link out of moodle mobile opens a new safari tab were access is "not allowed". any idea is welcome best regards beat

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Beat, please try the following: Copy the link in your OS device (you cannot copy it in the app, you'll have to copy it in browser). Open a new Safari tab manually. Paste the URL and open it. Check if you have access or not. If you have access in this new tab, try again with the app. The app should do exactly the same as the process I explained above. If you don't have access in this new tab then I guess it's a limitation of the page you're loading, maybe it is for security reasons. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Dani, Thanks for your answer. I tested on the iPad the senario in Safari mobile as you described it, unfortunately it's not working. but it works with google crome mobile. so it has to be a setting in Safari, do you have any idea what setting could couse this? and will it then also work out of the moodle app? then only this is the gool, if my studends cant use the links i put in for them - then it's useles. looking forward to your answer, best regards beat

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Beat, I don't know much about Safari iOS. I just did a couple of checks in iOS 12, maybe the settings are a bit different depending on your iOS version: In Safari, click a button with 2 squares (in iPad is in the top right, next to the button to open a new tab), it should display the tabs that you have opened. Check that the "Private" text is not selected. Go to device Settings and select the Safari option. Check that "Block all cookies" is disabled. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Dani, thanks for your feedback, that's it. best regards beat

ResponsesInList.Title: MM2 for Windows Phone
ResponsesInList.Text: Is the plan to release MM2 on the Windows Phone app store?  If so, do you have a timeline for release?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MM2 for Windows Phone
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jon, I'm sorry but I cannot provide you with a timeline right now, I will update this issue once we have an idea. Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MM2 for Windows Phone
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings Juan, I also used the windows app for several years and find the absence rather hindering.  I am wondering if you have an update on Windows 10 phone apps? With the advent of windows 10, I see Microsoft aggressively gaining back some of the education sector from Google with the sharing features in both desktop and web based apps, as well as the sync features on the 10 platform are very competitive. I recently learned that our institution may be taking a huge step toward Microsoft after years of google apps for education, and I suggest that this app become a priority again in windows formats. Have you an update on a timeline or any news on sponsors? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MM2 for Windows Phone
ResponsesInList.Text: Run this MySQL query on your DB. select userid, concat('',model,''), platform,version from `mdl_user_devices Kicks out a table with device platform and version with link to google checking out the platform. In a school district that is 100% Microsoft - desktop/ server (an exception being their Moodle server which is Linux) and who has decided to go 'bring your own device' ... Of 11,521 users (elem->HS Students and Facutly/Staff) there are only 9 users using Windows anything. Granted that's one district. Others care to share back? 'spirit of sharing', Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MM2 for Windows Phone
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jason, Windows share in the global smartphone market is less than 1% ( according last news ), with those numbers we can't simply spend time upgrading the app to support Windows devices. We did some estimations, and doing a windows version compatible it's a lot of hours of development. We are aware that a lot of universities are going to Microsoft services, but that doesn't mean that the people is going to switch to Windows phones. So, unfortunately, if the trend continues we won't we working in a windows version soon. Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MM2 for Windows Phone
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I want to let you know, that I'm (and some more students are) also very interested in MM2 for Windows Phone. The new Version is a big step forward that makes the app useful (as I can see on Android and iOS).  Maybe Astoria for WM10 can help? Kind regards ...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MM2 for Windows Phone
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ewald, unfortunately I cannot provide any update on this matter. As far as I know, the Ionic team (Ionic is the framework we use for creating the app) is testing the new Windows browser and WP version. I suppose they will have to apply some fixes and then we'll re-evaluate again porting the new version Regards, Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MM2 for Windows Phone
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan, can you tell us anything new on this matter? We've got about 10% to 20% on WM10 represented in our classes, but already more than 25% (steady growing) on W10 (tablet/laptop). And still there are no working PUSH-Messages for Moodle on WM10/W10. Under this circumstances I cannot declare this app to standard without leaving to many pupils behind. So far as I can see the IONIC framwork does not seem to make any progress on w10, or does it? What do you think about the projekt "islandwood"? Could this be an obvious solution? Regards, Ewald

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MM2 for Windows Phone
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ewald, I'm sorry but there are no news. Ionic framework did some progress on w10 (sponsored by Microsoft) but right now is something we are not to going to tray in the short-term. For laptop/desktop, we are evaluating http://electron.atom.io/ because that will make the app work in tablet not ARM with windows 10 and desktop/laptop Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle and SMS/mobile phones
ResponsesInList.Text: I was recently asked by a teacher about the possiblity of students not only using the mobile phones to not only access resources but also text message their responses into a Moodle forum or the like. Does anyone know if this is possible or not? Any information would be much appreciated. Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle and SMS/mobile phones
ResponsesInList.Text: For this to work I think you'd need an SMS to email relay, forwarding messages to a dedicated address, and they'd have to include things like a discussion ID in the message. And have their mobile number stored in their moodle profile so a script that reads/parses these emails could establish which user ID it belongs to. But it's not a bad idea. A cron-style activity that runs a few times a day maybe.

ResponsesInList.Title: Mobile Database Activity Not Working
ResponsesInList.Text: Hiya, On one Database Activity I get the following error when I view it on the mobile app (3.5): template has some errors and cannot be displayed I checked on the desktop with the console and there are a couple of php and js errors but it's not clear if they are due to the database. Is there a way to troubleshoot the template to find the error? Thanks, Nige.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mobile Database Activity Not Working
ResponsesInList.Text: Good day Otaku, I'd recommend you have a look and see if there perhaps isn't any database table upgrades that need to run as well as if the mods need an update. TO check and see if anything Moodle related needs an update, you can simply go to your website instance via a browser, log in as admin and then adjust the URL to: your-url-here/admin/index.php. As for the plugins/mods you can navigate to Site Administration > Plugins > Plugins Overview and then click on the "Check for updates" button. This should indicate if there are any plugin/mod updates available. Once you start upgrading those another button will be displayed on the bottom of the upgrade page that will update the effected database tables, if there are any. Hope this helps with troubleshooting.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Mobile R&D
ResponsesInList.Text: Good day, A bit of background on my request. One of our Moodle clients is planning to start implementing the Moodle Mobile Application as part of their course roll-outs, but they need a few things changed before hand. I'm currently trying to set up a list of things that can and can't be changed and so far it's going very slowly. I understand that the mobile theme can be adjusted and that the non-core activity icons are pulled from the web service, whereas the core icons are pulled from the mobile applications assets directory. I was wondering if anyone knows of or has a list of things that can and can't be changed externally to effect what is seen on the mobile application? I'm currently using ( https://mobileapp.moodledemo.net/ ) to find specific css tags for elements so we know what to set in our custom css theme, but other things like specific wording being displayed on buttons I'm not sure if those are pulled from the web service, or if they are also part of the mobile language pack? Simple example would be the "Post to Forum" button. I've gone and adjust the display text on the clients server , but I'm not sure if that text is being pulled through to the app or not. I've restarted Apache and re-logged into the site via the mobile app, but it still displays the same "Post to Forum" text. I'm not sure if the mobile display text is cached and hasn't updated with the new changes, thus pulled from the web service language pack or if it's pulled from a mobile language pack without actually seeing the mobile applications code. So in short if there is anyone who knows where I can find an easy way to view the applications code or has a list of things that can and can't be adjusted I would much appreciate the help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile R&D
ResponsesInList.Text: So in short I've gone and downloaded the Moodle Mobile application's APK file from Google Play Store, converted and unzipped the package and imported the project into Android Studios. From there I found that the display text is in-fact pulled from the mobile language packs and not the web service. There are currently 43 language packs available in the source code, as mentioned in the translation.moodle.org discussions.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: custom mobile app - phonegap building
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ludovico, you can create a custom app using the phonegapbuild repository, but please take into account that you might need to apply some changes manually to the build file (build/mm.bundle.js). E.g. the fields in config.json are converted to an angular constant in that file. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Support for course activities
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Anthony, are you trying to use the Guzzle library in the app itself? Or the app is calling a WebService you developed and this WebService is using the Guzzle library? Please notice usually the app communicates with Moodle using WebServices, the app doesn't include any external lib you might have installed in Moodle. Cheers, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: UniqueLogin for Moodle Mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: There has been some discussion on the need to restrict multiple people from using the same login to access moodle via mobile app. Unfortunately no solution seems to be forthcoming, yet. It's a shame because the uniquelogin was integrated into the Moodle core because it is a real and clear requirement. Developers of the mobile app must try to recognize this user requirement and given  the common database , try to figure out a way that Uniquelogin is enforced for mobile access also. The imperatives of mobile access is inescapable today, and mobile dev cannot wash their hands off this issue but saying that there is no solution. E lse the browser solution restriction is also negated by this backdoor. I request the dev team to revisit this issue and provide a solution to the community.

ResponsesInList.Title: Modile Mobile Android vs iOS
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, our institution is planing to buy tablet for using Moodle mobile on them. What would be the recommendations which to choose android or iOs?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Modile Mobile Android vs iOS
ResponsesInList.Text: I recommend Android. The hardware is significantly cheaper and Moodle does not require any of the possible hardware advantages of of iOS devices. I speak as someone with a 2018 iPad, but that is because is really good at audio/music so no advantage for Moodle. I recently purchased a pre-loved Amazon Kindle specifically for using/testing Moodle mobile and even shiny new they are very cheap. The other subtle advantage is that there are vastly more Android devices in the world so you can be confident that the Moodle App and any plugins will have been used more/tested more on Android. I used to work somewhere that had a rack of iPads and they seemed to require a great deal of management, particularly as they are at heart single user devices.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Modile Mobile Android vs iOS
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for your answer, I really appreciate it. Could you also express your opinion about managing Android and iOS tablets during the Moodle quizzes.  I mean that Apple has Classroom app for iPads's management. Maybe in this situation iPads are more convenient?

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Mobile & iOs9
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, if you have upgrade your iOs device to iOs9 you will notice that Moodle Mobile is not working. This is because iOs9 has introduced some regressions in the WebView component used by the app and this change make the app to display multiple errors. We fixed that bug last Friday (in Moodle Mobile 2.2) but this version is still in review. Hopefully this new version will be published in following days. More information here: http://blog.ionic.io/ios-9-potential-breaking-change/ We're very sorry for the inconveniences, Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile & iOs9
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle Mobile 2.2 was approved last Saturday in app store, please, update the app as soon as possible.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile & iOs9
ResponsesInList.Text: The fix is not integrated in master yet (it was an emergency release, we patched the phonegap-build version) In any case, you can find the code here: https://github.com/moodlehq/moodlemobile2/compare/master...dpaloucva:MOBILE-1225 As you can see, it requires minor changes Juan

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dani, Thanks for your quick answer. There're two ways to access our problematic site, one of then certainly redirects: http://moodle.uco.es/enoa2 If you configure this URL in the app, you get a brief error message before showing the login screen, and no credential are accepted, even if they're valid. The second one doesn't redirect, at least to my knowledge. Its  behaviour is the originally posted: http://moodle.uco.es/exa Let me confirm with our systems staff that no redirection happens in this site, and, if so, I'll provide you with a test account. I'll post again on Monday. Best regards
role: Picture of Francisco José Esteban Risueño

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle mobile works OK in two sites, but KO on the remaining
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi again, Dani: After checking it with our systems staff and analysing the http session with browser developer tools, I can confirm that no redirection happens when using http://moodle.uco.es/exa . I'll just send the testing account. Thanks for your assistance. Regards.
role: Picture of Francisco José Esteban Risueño

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle mobile works OK in two sites, but KO on the remaining
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi again, the first site fails because of the redirect. When you enter your credentials, the app performs a request to MOODLEURL/login/token.php, where MOODLEURL is the URL you entered in the first screen. Since you have that redirect, the request ends up being sent to: http://moodle.uco.es/exa/course/index.php?categoryid=2/login/token.php That URL isn't valid, so the login fails. Regarding the other URL, I tested adding an invalid username and your server is returning some debugging data that it shouldn't. The request to login/token.php should return only a JSON string, but in your site it's returning some text outside of the JSON and that's causing the app to fail because it expects a JSON. I'll send you a private message with more details. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle mobile works OK in two sites, but KO on the remaining
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi again, Dani: Problem solved! It can be seen by your private message that there was debug information sent with the HTTP response. In our case, it was associated with the external database authentication. In order to avoid the problem, the choice "ADPdb debug" must be set to "No" in the External Database Authentication plugin. Now all is up and running, just using our direct access moodle.uco.es/exa in the app. Thank you very much for your assistance. Moodle is by far the best e-learning system you can use! Best regards
role: Picture of Francisco José Esteban Risueño

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle App CSS not working
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Patrick, you need to open Chrome or Chromium with the following flags to be able to prevent those CORS errors: --allow-file-access-from-files --disable-web-security --user-data-dir --allow-running-insecure-content It is explained in here: https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Moodle_Mobile_development_using_Chrome_or_Chromium#Installation We usually recommend Chromium over Chrome, I think Chrome doesn't support one of those flags but I'm not sure about that. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Access to DNS restriction Vimeo in SCORM activity in Moodle App
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, First, I would like to say that we really like the Moodle app, it's very useful for our users. The problem we have with it right now is that our users are not able to watch our videos Vimeo , only available in the domain of our Moodle . These video are embed in the SCORM activity . It works perfectly in the site in SCORM activity in the Moodle App on Page activity Not in the Moodle App in SCORM activity Is there something we can do on the site ou in SCORM ou in Vimeo to make it work? Thank you for your help!

ResponsesInList.Title: Alternative solution with webservice token in scorm
ResponsesInList.Text: Solved ! I want to thank Dani of Moodle App team 🤩, and share with you his answer. We only use the script in content rendered by the app, content rendered in an iframe is not treated. That's why it works in Page (the app replaces the original Vimeo link and uses the wsplayer.php script instead), but it's not working for SCORM because the SCORM content is rendered in an iframe. What we always recommend in cases like this is to contact Vimeo and ask them to support restricting videos by user agent too, not just by URL . That way you could configure the video to work in the app. Hopefully if they keep getting requests like this they might implement it in the future. If the client doesn't want to make the videos public, the only solution I can think of is that you edit the SCORM package and manually replace the links to Vimeo to use the wsplayer.php instead. This wsplayer script requires the video ID and a user token (to make sure that only users authenticated in the site can view the video), so you should create a new user that isn't enrolled to any course or anything (because his token can be used to call any WebService), create a WebService token for this user and then use it in the SCORM. The URLs to the site will need to be hardcoded, so this SCORM will only work for a specific site. E.g. if the SCORM has an iframe pointing to https://player.vimeo.com/video/VIDEOID , you should replace the URL with YOURSITEURL/media/player/vimeo/wsplayer.php?video=VIDEOID&token=TOKEN The solution is quite ugly, but it's the only one I can think of.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MM2 - Audio Files not playing
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Tim, I had a look at this issue too, it seems that this is coming from network security feature most likely set up by your system administrator. When I accessed your site, I could not listen to the audio clips either. The requests to those files were forbidden with the following message: HTTP/1.1 407 Proxy Authentication Required I am guessing that the request is allowed providing that my proxy details have been set as you'd expect them, which is not something the app has control over. Another thing I noticed is that the URL to your files are pointing to a draft area "draftfile.php". That does not seem right, draft files are temporary and should not be used to serve content. Technically you might be able to access them if you were the user uploading them, but drafts are usually deleted with 4 days. The URL pointing to your resource should contain "pluginfile.php" in order to work both in a browser, and in the app. That problem can often arise when copying content from one place to another. I hope this helps. Cheers, Fred

In our organization we also use moodle a lot for smaller courses meant to be accessed through the mobile app, but as it is now it seems that I can only access courses that I am already enrolled in on the app. I therefore have this question: Is it in any way possible to
enroll yourself to courses through the moodle mobile app? I mean, I can search and find
courses in the app, no problem, but it says “you can not enroll yourself in
this course” on the enrolment page, even though it is open for me. Thanks for input! //Christoffer

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enrolling to courses through the moodle mobile app?
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe there is an Enrol Me button built into the app. But if the page Enrolment Methods aren't setup correctly, it won't allow self enrolment on the website let alone the app.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enrolling to courses through the moodle mobile app?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Cristofer, but the courses are just open (not requiring enrolment) or they are configured to allow users to enrol themselves? Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Error en preguntas "arrastrar y soltar sobre una imagen"
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi María Luisa 'Drag and drop' questions in quizzes in the Moodle App are actually tap and drop . You cannot drag the answer, but if you tap de answer and drop it in the correct place it works. Kind regards, Isabel _________________ Hola María Luisa

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Error en preguntas "arrastrar y soltar sobre una imagen"

Isabel! All right! thanks pr the help!
I think the images must be large so they can take the text. Creo que las imágenes deben ser grandes para que puedan tomar el texto. En la pregunta donde no funciona esta opción "la zona" donde se debe soltar la frase es pequeña y no se activa para "recibir" la frase.

ResponsesInList.Title: Students: Adding a photo to an online text assignment in Mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text:
Dear Mobile App users,

I'm confounded in my efforts to find the method by which students can attach a photo to an online text assignment OR a forum post using the Mobile app. It seems like it should be a pretty basic operation, however I'm not able to find documentation on this user operation.

Can someone point me in the right direction? Sorry for the simplistic question.

Edit: OK, I can see where to add a file in a forum (clicking "Advanced"), but in an assignment that doesn't exist. Must I enable "file submissions" to make it work in an assignment? (that isn't needed on the desktop interface, so I'm just wondering).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students: Adding a photo to an online text assignment in Mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there, The editor in the app doesn't support uploading images. This happens mostly everywhere, but the advanced section is enabled in some parts (such as the forum) where it's important to have images. If you want to accept images in an assignment you can accept file submissions and restrict the file type to images.

ResponsesInList.Title: mTouch-U, mobile moodle for all mobile devices
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All, We have finished first stage development of mTouch-U web app, which allows students to access moodle from most of the modern mobile browsers. You can test mTouch-U from http://mtouch.pragmasql.com for free (no registration needed). We are seeking for partners worldwide to host mTouch-U and we are open to all kind of partnership possibilities from all organizations using or hosting Moodle. Here is what mTouch-U supports as of 13 December 2010 * Resources support * Grade Overview and Grade User Report by course * Upcoming Events(Calendar) * Breadcrumb based navigation through Menu select * Full Chat support * Full Glossary support with entry comment display and management * Full forum support * External/Unsupported url(page) display added * Groups support for assignments * Post/Edit online submission * Post/Edit assignment note * Detach files from an assignment * Attach files to an assignment * Display details of a selected assignment * Display list of assignments for the selected course * Display course topics of a selected course * Getting list of enrolled courses * Default login to Moodle sites

Having logged in I can see the courses we offer, with their associated assignments. But I cannot find any way to upload a file in order to submit an assignment. Is that because I am a teacher? I will get a student to test it when they have access to it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ynt: Re: mTouch-U, mobile moodle for all mobile devices
ResponsesInList.Text:
We do not have multiple profile support on our demo installation. In our commercial product we offer multiple profiles. The workflow is something like that

* Create an account on mTouch-U
* Define your Moodle credentials (storing password is optional) for multiple moodle sites
* Login to mTouch-U with your mTouch-U username and password
* Select your moodle account from the list
* If you did not set the password provide the password
* Click login and you are ready to go

ResponsesInList.Title: Ynt: Re: Ynt: Re: mTouch-U, mobile moodle for all mobile devices
ResponsesInList.Text:
I thought you would like to define multiple profiles on mTouch-U demo site, mTouch iPhone app does not have multiple profile support.

We can add this in the future releases.

ResponsesInList.Title: Ynt: Re: Ynt: Re: mTouch-U, mobile moodle for all mobile devices
ResponsesInList.Text:
Please discard the previous message regarding the multiple profile support.
mTouch and mTouch+ already have multiple profile support. Please follow these steps to create multiple profiles and use them

* Add your moodle url, credentials and other preferences on the Login view
* Touch on +Profile button on the Login view. This will create a new profile base on your current input

* In order to use already saved profile pelase touch on the Profiles button which is located on the top right (navigation bar area) of Login view

* Select a profile from the list
* Login view will be populated with data coming from the selected profile
* Touch on Login button and login to your moodle.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Mobile - Conditional Access
ResponsesInList.Text: HI ! Is there a way by which we can make access to Moodle Mobile App conditional ? For example I would like to reward some of the students with access to their courses through Moodle Mobile App after completion of a certain activity only. So far we have not activated the access to Moodle Mobile App (MMA). Going ahead we want to grant access of MMA to students in batches with the prerequisite. Please guide me. Thanks and regards Deepak Bhalla

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile - Conditional Access
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm thinking Roles. Clone the Student system role as Student Mobile, then you can change the value of the permission moodle/webservice:createmobiletoken So for the Student Mobile role this would be ALLOW, and for the normal student it would stay as PREVENT. Then on a course by course basis you can choose which students do and don't have access to that course via the app. Not automatically that I can tell from within moodle - in theory, you could write a script that ran nightly or similar to inspect the database for the conditions to put them into the Student Mobile role for a course. Or maybe someone who knows the really technical stuff better can help with that. HTH though.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Mobile Beta is available !
ResponsesInList.Text: We are pleased to introduce the Beta version of the new official cross-platform Moodle Mobile app! Our Moodle Mobile app is a HTML5-based client that connects to an installed Moodle server . It does not try to replicate everything that Moodle does - we are focussed on providing features that are most useful on a standalone app, such as offline access to content, messaging and notifications. Please try the new features (and bugs!) and give us feedback on how you would like the app to develop in future. The app may be a little rough around the edges, but we’ll be pushing out bug fixes frequently. Roadmap 1.2 roadmap - April View current progress 1.2 is the initial port of our IOS native app. The version number ended at 1.1. We continue from there. 1.3 roadmap - June View 1.3 progress For 1.3 we’ll continue polishing and fixing issues. 1.4 roadmap - August View 1.4+ progress Starting from 1.4 we’ll add one feature per version. It’s most likely going to be the push notifications for 1.4 . We’ll stand on a 2 month period for release but we may be faster depending of the development speed. In the Agile progress dashboard you’ll be able to visualize the issues for the next version, the version after it, and a backlog of issue for further version. Supported devices All versions can be downloaded from Phonegap Build iOS Limited to registered QA testers - if you don’t mind to report issue on the tracker you can integrate the iOS QA team. Send us an email to mobile@moodle.com . Android Also available on Google Play store . Windows 7 / WebOS / Symbian These version are available but are not tested, neither even supported by HQ. Note that we currently don’t have any plan to support other OS than Android and iOS. If you are experienced in HTML5 Mobile development and are serious about long term maintenance of a different OS, I’ll assign you the related issues with a big smile of happiness. Contact me at mobile@moodle.com . Requirements The app will be useless unless these conditions are satisfied: 1) Your Moodle site must have Moodle 2.4 MINIMUM. 2) Your administrator must have activated Mobile web services. 3) You have a valid user account for that site. If you don't have access to a Moodle site for testing you can try our demo site using a little shortcut we added. Type student or teacher in the url and then the Go button. The app will automatically connect to School Demo . (this doesn’t work yet in the Google Play version) Bugs and requests Main page View current progress Caution This is a Beta version, we do not recommend it for use on production sites (even though the chances of anything going wrong are really extremely low ;) ) Developers Juan Leyva Architecture design, coding, documentation, debugging tools. Barbara Ramiro Original graphic design. Jerome Mouneyrac Project management, testing, releases. Martin Dougiamas Supervising, testing, feedback, editing, prodding. Development community This app has been designed to be used and tweaked by users such as universities, schools, and companies.   We hope to build a development community around the Moodle Mobile app to help it develop faster.  We expect the structure to be fully stable by July, and we’ll make an announcement at that time, so that developers can create derivative projects with a lower risk of refactors in the standard version.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Stefan, we'll be creating soon some sample code and plugins repository in github so you can use it as an example for your block. Meanwhile, could you check the example here? https://github.com/moodleou/moodle-block_news or https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/ MOBILE-2935

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to make blocks visible in Moodle Mobile App?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Esther, the Moodle code to display the block in the app is the same for course blocks and for dashboard blocks, so the news block example should work for dashboard blocks too. Please notice that your Moodle site should be 3.6 or higher in order for this to work, otherwise the app has no way of knowing which blocks are in the dashboard. For course blocks, Moodle 3.3 or higher is required. Cheers, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Mobile App and Security
ResponsesInList.Text: I am loving the functionality of the Moodle Mobile App. I work for a not-for-profit and our IT department are doing a security assessment on the Moodle Mobile App. Has your company done something similar? Who do you work for and are you happy with the Moodle Mobile App's security?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile App and Security
ResponsesInList.Text: We were happy to recommend it, as a college. It has some basic failsafes in such as declaring self-signed certificates as invalid, and not storing your login details in the app (it creates a token). And it's developed by moodle HQ, who aren't going to monkey around when it comes to security. Juan (chief developer) can probably chime in with more technical justification.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile App and Security
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Dave. That's very helpful.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile App and Security
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Andrew, the app is widely used by institutions around the world and we've never received any complaint about security. The app doesn't store the user credentials, it uses a token that is generated the first time the user access (the token is valid for 3 months). Mobile services are only enabled by default in sites using https. We only allow certain features (like auto-login from the app to the site) via https and under certain security restrictions (using a special secured token created the first time a user access). The Mobile service only exposes a subset of the Moodle features (for example, no admin web services are enabled in the mobile service). As long as you site uses https, it will be very safe to use the mobile app (but that also applies to websites, https is mandatory these days) Regards, Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile App and Security
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you Juan.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile App and Security
ResponsesInList.Text: I've noticed that after making the changes suggested in the install guide, " Go to Site administration > Users > Permissions > Define roles , edit the Authenticated user role and allow the capability moodle/webservice:createtoken. " that Moodle's own security report marks the 'Default role for all users' as being critically insecure. Additionally when you do that step it sets off every internal warning regarding security risks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile App and Security
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, what Moodle version are you using? If I remember well, this security check was removed recently in 3.2 Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Disable caching (downloading for offline use) of a course page in mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: In my Moodle course, I am embedding a Bunny.net video with a protection that contains expiration check with a secure token included in the URL of the video. That token needs to be recalculated every time video is open. I wrote a custom Moodle filter that calculates this secure token and embeds an iframe that loads external video from Bunny.net with URL including this token. It works fine on web, but on mobile there is an issue that video is working fine only on first opening. After the token expiration period is over (6 hours), the video stops working. The issue is probably in the fact that Moodle mobile app caches the content of the course page. I need to have this page to be opened fresh, without caching and offline downloading. When I delete the offline content for this video page in Moodle mobile app, video works fine again until expiration period is over. So my question, is there a way to stop Moodle mobile app to cache / download for offline a certain page or entire course?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Disable caching (downloading for offline use) of a course page in mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: I completely disabled offline use according to https://docs.moodle.org/405/en/Moodle_app_offline_features , but it does not work, the app always downloads and caches my page with video (I tried logout from the app). In the above link, there area another configuration options mentioned: Site administrators can decide if they want: Disable completely the offline mode Disable all courses downloading Disable individual courses downloading For disabling the previous features, please see Moodle app guide for admins . But there is nothing about disabling individual courses downloading in Moodle app guide for admins. Can anyone guide me to the right place?

ResponsesInList.Title: Save Password
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, Do you think that can be integrated a "save password" function? Thank and Regards,Claudio

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Save Password
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Claudio, storing the user password is a big security risk so we've always avoided doing so. Anyone with access to the device could retrieve that password and decrypt it . Regards, Dani

The hostname should be https://servername.com , but the app keeps trying https://www.servername.com which  does not work.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Custom Moodle App prepends www to hostname
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Leon, the Moodle Mobile app always perform the same steps to connect to a site: Try the input URL with https protocol. If it fails, add or remove 'www' from the URL and try again with https protocol. If it fails, try the input URL with http protocol. If it fails, add or remove 'www' from the URL and try again with http protocol. If you look at the network tab you should see those 4 requests. Cheers, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Mobile API Question
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Maybe someone can clear up the Mobile framework.  From some of the documentation I have found this looks to be a API that is being created for open source apps and in others an app only provided by Moodle orginization itself.  Can someone better explain to me what is going on with this because I am interested in building an app for my university since they have recently integrated to the Moodle from Blackboard.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mobile API Question
ResponsesInList.Text: I don't understand your question, if by "Moodle Organisation" you mean Moodle.org (i.e. Moodle HQ), I am not aware of any code released by them that is not under the GPL.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mobile API Question
ResponsesInList.Text: Sorry for the "typo" and not calling it 'Moodle HQ'. I believe my confusion stemmed from their use of the term "native application" that Moodle HQ uses when referring the actual Moodle framework, not the OS.  I also now understand how OS specific apps can be written using server side modules that allow remote connection to the framework.  There are several open source projects available (mtouch, MLE, etc).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mobile API Question
ResponsesInList.Text: I think the phrase you want is ' Web Services '.  Look there for a lot of info. Basically this is an API that is designed to be secure, maintained and stable over releases.  This takes a lot of time to get right so they are expanding slowly. Other people are knocking together quick web services (installed as a 3rd party plugin) but it's very likely that they will break in future or, worse, open up security issues on your server.  Check such code very carefully before relying on it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Restrict Messaging from Moodle Mobile
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi We have recently enabled messaging to the site and to avoid abuse we have implemented the code tweak here Messaging:
Method to restrict student messages to teachers only so messages are only sent to or from teachers. The students can not send messages to each other. This code has worked great in normal browser sessions but obviously does not work in the mobile app. The app allows anybody to anybody messaging. After looking through code i think the file in <moodle>\message\externallib.php handles the code and i have tried putting in an if statment around line 130 if(!user_has_role_assignment($tousers[$message['touserid']],3)) { $success = false; $errormessage = "invalid message recipient"; } At the moment I just have a text string for the error rather than loading from the language file as I am not sure if i am looking in the correct place. I dont expect anyone to do the work for me but i was wondering if anyone knew if i am on the right track or if I am wasting my time. In the past when adjusting code, i have always done temporary print statments to the browser to make sure variables are what I am expecting etc but I am assuming i can't do with this the mobile app - is there any equivalent i could use as I feel i am coding in the dark with this? Hope this makes sense Ian

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restrict Messaging from Moodle Mobile
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Ian, yes, you need to edit the externallib.php file (because is the file exporting the Web Services that the mobile app uses). If you want to see debugging in the app, you will have to setup a local environment to test the app in the browser, or debug the app via Chrome and monitor the XHR requests. This is explained here: https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Moodle_Mobile_development_using_Chrome_or_Chromium (see screenshots) Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Is Moodle App (Android and Apple) the same as the desktop version?
ResponsesInList.Text: I’m trying to figure out if the desktop version of Moodle is effectively the same as the mobile app? I.e - can I design the colours etc and it will apply to both? Also, out of interest - Id we were to plump for the custom, bespoke Moodle app - would this also mean we’d benefit from a custom, bespoke Moodle desktop version or is this something entirely different? I’m guessing it’s the same thing essentially, but interested to know more.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is Moodle App (Android and Apple) the same as the desktop version?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, yes, it is effectively the same application. You will have the same features but adapted to desktop (for example, notifications will be displayed in the operating system notification center). Regards, Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is Moodle App (Android and Apple) the same as the desktop version?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan That's great, thanks for your response. Is I were to purchase the bespoke custom Moodle App package - would this mean I'd also benefit from a custom Windows Desktop app?  Or is this separate? Thanks Eddie

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is Moodle App (Android and Apple) the same as the desktop version?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Eddie, I think it is a separate package, please use the contact form https://moodle.com/mobileapp/ for detailed information Regards, Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Custom login Page
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, We are looking at customizing the mobile app as the official lms mobile app for our institution. To do this, I have read extensively about how to customize an authenticated page, which is done  through the mobilecssurl within a typical moodle installation. But my major problems are as follows 1. How do I customize the login Page using the source code provided in github. This is because as you all know, no matter the changes made in the css file hooked on your moodle installation, it doesn't affect the login page. So how do I modify it to suite my needs. 2. Is it possible to lunch the bigbluebutton plugin in the mobile app, if not, how do I modify the source codes to accept that. Thanks a lot in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Custom login Page
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Nicholas, 1. If you're creating a custom app then you can just change the app's CSS. If you've set your development environment following this guide then you should place your CSS code in a SCSS file and then run gulp to build the final CSS. We usually split the SCSS files in each component/addon to keep it organized, but you can add it all to www/core/scss/styles.scss for simplicity. If you're using Phonegap Build and you don't use gulp, then you should add your CSS to www/build/mm.bundle.css 2. The official app doesn't support BigBlueButton. You should create an app plugin (www/addons) implementing the BigBlueButton features you need, but I don't think this'll be an easy task. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Custom login Page
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Daniel, Thanks for the quick response, first of all with regards to the page customization, I get it, but my worry is, what css parameters or variables do I use in accessing or modifying the login page. Are there any particular ones I have to reference in modifying the login page. I would be grateful if you can point me towards those directions. I appreciate your concern about the enormous effort required in creating an app plugin for implementing the bigbluebutton, however if that is so, wouldn't it be possible to allow the external tool plugin within the mobille app to open that in a browser ? Thanks, Nicholas

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Custom login Page
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Nicholas, unfortunately we don't have a list of elements and CSS classes for customization yet, it's something we have pending. So you'll have to inspect the elements you want to modify and see the rules applied to the,. The easiest way is to test it in browser , but you can inspect it in your devices too if you install a custom build. You have a web version of the app in here if you want to inspect it without having to set up a development environment: http://prototype.moodle.net/mobile/webapp/ Please notice you'll only be able to connect to Moodle 3.0 or higher due to CORS. Regarding BigBlueButton, the application opens mod_lti activities using an embedded browser (InAppBrowser), I'm not sure if BigBlueButton is going to work in there, you could try. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Custom login Page
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Daniel, Thanks for the directions so far, I am going to look them and revert to you. Thanks a lot, Nicholas

ResponsesInList.Title: User Role ! moodlemobile
ResponsesInList.Text: I want to distinguish between student and teacher in Moodlemobile how is that done ! I checked this function in profile.js but it doesn't return anything for both student and teacher ! what's wrong ! $mmUser.formatRoleList(user.roles).then(function(roles) { user.roles = roles; console.log('roles :'+roles); });

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User Role ! moodlemobile
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Mounir, there is no way to know if a user is a student or a teacher. The reason is that every site can have different capabilities for teacher/student. So the only thing that the app knows is if the user can perform certain actions or not. For example, using the WebServices: core_course_get_user_administration_options core_course_get_user_navigation_options mod_forum_can_add_discussion Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Navigation in Moodle for mobile between sites connected with MNet
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi! We have a Moodle Main Site where the user logs normally. From there the user can go to our other Moodle sites authenticating by MNet. We configured the Moodle Mobile additional features plugin, when we test the App goes well in the Main Site, then we select  the Website option to see in the browser the link that leads to the other sites but the user have to authenticate again How can we do so by selecting one of the other sites the user are accessed within the app and do not remain in the browser? Can the Moodle App have the Network servers block ? Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Navigation in Moodle for mobile between sites connected with MNet
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Erika, the app currently does not support access or listing MNet sites. If you want to access to a connected site, you must install the local_mobile plugin there, configure it to login via the browser, and ask your user to connect to that site using the site URL . The browser will open pointing to your linked site, and once the user has completed the login (he will be redirected to your "base" site) he will be able to access the MNet site Cheers, Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: International Domain Name (IDN) in Login Page and Accounts List
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi David, The app shows what is saved on wwwroot . Could you check that? Kind regards, Isabel

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: International Domain Name (IDN) in Login Page and Accounts List

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dave, Thank you for the info! Made the changes but they aren't showing. I'm wondering if they will only work if we register for the premium version of the app? Cheers, Steven

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle app CSS for icons
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Steven - Yes you do need to have a 'Premium plan' to be able to make CSS changes to the app. And there are quite a few steps to go through to be able to make changes to the app - I managed it eventually and created a blog post/video to hopefully make it easier for others: https://davefoord.wordpress.com/2023/05/31/moodle-tricks-of-the-trade-adding-your-own-css-to-the-moodle-mobile-app/

ResponsesInList.Title: White page when using official docker container
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi guys, I'm trying to get the Moodle Mobile app running in docker. I'm using the official docker container ( https://hub.docker.com/r/moodlehq/moodlemobile2 ). What I've done is, I simply pulled the container from the docker hub and finally started the container: docker pull moodlehq/moodlemobile2 cls && docker run -p 8100:8100 moodlehq/moodlemobile2 I'm finally getting the following output: > moodlemobile@3.8.0 ionic:serve /app > npx gulp watch & npx ionic-app-scripts serve -b --devapp --address=0.0.0.0 [09:40:44] Using gulpfile /app/gulpfile.js [09:40:44] Starting 'watch'... [09:40:46]  ionic-app-scripts 3.2.2 [09:40:46]  watch started ... [09:40:46]  build dev started ... [09:40:46]  clean started ... [09:40:46]  clean finished in 1 ms [09:40:46]  copy started ... Unfortunately, when I try to access http://localhost:8100 I'm getting a white page only. In 2016/2017 there was a discussion ( https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=342928 ) about the white screen but I'm not sure the correct reason (maybe the missing siteurl). But how can I specify the siteurl for the docker container? Do I need to create my own docker container? Instead of the white screen I expected to see a input field (like https://stackoverrun.com/de/q/11157241 ). Any ideas/suggestions?

ResponsesInList.Title: learn management system
ResponsesInList.Text: how to join mobile apps to the moodle? i have developed mobile apps but do not know to connact to moodle

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: learn management system
ResponsesInList.Text: You must use WebServices: http://docs.moodle.org/dev/Web_services Here you have an example of HTML5 mobile app using Web Services with links to the source code https://moodle.org/plugins/view.php?id=175

ResponsesInList.Title: Mobile app does not work. Letsencrypt?
ResponsesInList.Text: Our site is learn.kodekonveyor.com it is available only on https, using a letsencrypt certificate. I have checked everything I could (mobile app is enabled, moodle version is okay; '3.7+ (Build: 20190614)'), and the same site works with the desktop app on my computer. The only thing I have found is that one of the ssl checkers recommended in this site says that the letsencrypt root cert is not in the certificate chain. Does the mobile app recognize letsencrypt? Or is it depending on the mobile os (Android in this case)? Is it the problem, or should I search further? If the problem with letsencrypt, can I avoid somehow to use another certificate?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mobile app does not work. Letsencrypt?
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm not aware of letsencrypt, but if you had to install the certificate yourself on your own (on premise) web server , then you may not have done it correctly. They should have a guide for how to do it, or be able to signpost you to instructions. If you are using a 3rd party hosting company, far better off getting them to provide and install the certificate for you - that's what you're paying for after all, them to do the fiddly stuff that is server level compared to webapp level (generally speaking). HTH

ResponsesInList.Title: Tárgy: Re: Mobile app does not work. Letsencrypt?
ResponsesInList.Text: Letsencrypt have a command line tool to handle the installation, and I have enough experience to say that there is no problem with the certificate install beyond that - as it is not a commercial entity - some organizations might not recognize it as a legit root CA. However most of the browsers acknowledge it nowadays.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Mobile with Moodle 3.1
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I have had many problems trying to get the APP to work properly and I am almost there after installing the mobile additional features plugin etc. However, now when a student is writing their online text and finished, they go to save and they get the error message "invalid parameter value detected". I have tried looking at the permissions, the external services etc and I still can't find the solution to this problem. Can anyone please help? The other problem is that I am not receiving notifications on my mobile when edits to forums (replies etc) or a new forum is created... Thanks, Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile with Moodle 3.1
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mark, Really sorry for the late reply. Are you still having trouble? Have you tried updating to a newer version? Cheers, Berta

ResponsesInList.Title: Mobile Annotation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Is it at all possible to annotate submitted assignments via the app using a tablet and e-pen. If not is this something that is planned to be added, or what would it take to add this feature. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mobile Annotation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Justin, right now it isn't supported in the app. The only grading that can be done in the app is numerical, using outcomes and/or giving feedback (typed text). Editing the submission like it's done in web isn't supported in the app and we don't have plans to support it soon since it's a quite complex feature. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle mobile customization: display blank page
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Please help anyone: I have been having a lot of trouble with the customisation of moodle mobile app. I have followed all the instructions on the docs but I did not succeed to get it right. Please help, below is the link to my github: https://github.com/LaurentKay/bloomACA.git I am using the android branch. Please see if I am missing anything. When the app is compile using phonegap, after installing the app, I only get a blank page. Thanks for you help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle mobile App
ResponsesInList.Text: I use the moodle app for a course so students can upload movie files as an assignement. But is it also possible for the students to record the movie first and then load it up? So people can practices first and then load the movie... I tried it myself using an Iphone but I only can record movies straight away and upload it...  I had some who was able to upload an file... see used other type of phone. Are there differences in kind of smartphone type? Hope to hear from anyone.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle mobile App
ResponsesInList.Text: I downloaded this app, but unfortunatly I can't feel all benefits of it, cause it doesn't lounch.. I need to use old app on my pc or use bluestacks to work well, but it doesn't feels, like it's mobile that way.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle mobile App
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Rogier, If you are using an iOS device you should check this: Sharing files with Moodle Mobile with iOS In Android devices, there's the option to upload different types of files with the Upload dialogue screen. Cheers, Berta

```text
here
```

ResponsesInList.Title: App sending multiple copies of the same message (How can we stop this?)
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hello we have been
using Moodle at our school since 2012. Most recently, we updated our system
from 3.6 to version 3.8 after a server change and have now opted in the Premium
Plan in the app model. The system occasionally has 20,000 accesses per day. We are using the default Airnotifier messaging server with the default moodle mobile app. Although the
update went smoothly, we have great difficulties with the notifications. We
receive a lot of emails several times, even days later. PUSH messages are also
sent multiple times. The messages come from group chats and forum posts as well
as from private messages. It looks as if a login of the sender to the system
would trigger the re-dispatch. Based on the
forum contributions here: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=390198 a nd here: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=362959#p1530200? I could see a message being sent from the app, but the clock icon remained.
The generated email arrived only 1 minute later, the PUSH message did not
arrive at all. The process aborted and a new process was created. The app also
marked the message as sent, while a copy of the original message automatically
appeared in the app, which in turn remained with the clock icon. If another
next message is sent, the previous message is marked as sent, while the new
message is now sent again and again. A glance at the log suggests that a login
of the sender or participant of a group will restart the process. The call of the
service via the browser showed that the process is going through perfectly for
some students, while for other students it dies and causes the browser to
crash. Our administrator
was able to contribute the following messages: “I see many
entries in the log that indicate a problem with the airserver: "[Tue Apr 28
21:37:00.727720 2020] [php7:notice] [pid 867] [client 91.249.185.4:63019] Debugging: Unexpected response from the Airnotifier server:  in \n* line 173 of /message/output/airnotifier/classes/manager.php: call to debugging()\n* line 92 of /message/output/airnotifier/classes/manager.php: call to message_airnotifier_manager->create_token()\n* line 110 of /message/output/airnotifier/message_output_airnotifier.php: call to message_airnotifier_manager->get_user_devices()\n* line 501 of /lib/classes/message/manager.php: call to message_output_airnotifier->send_message()\n* line 308 of /lib/classes/message/manager.php: call to core\\message\\manager::call_processors()\n* line 276 of /lib/classes/message/manager.php: call to I don't find
the error text really helpful now, the most meaningful is perhaps "Unexpected
response". More exciting is a small comparison: zgrep air moodle-error.log*.gz|wc
-l 3764 results. So there were 3764 calls that resulted in an error. zgrep airnotifier moodle-access.log*.gz|wc
-l 35 results. So there were 35 calls that _no_ error. " I have now
disabled the messaging feature in the app and in fact the bad messages have decreased. But that's not the solution. Where can we start now?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: App sending multiple copies of the same message (How can we stop this?)
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi Ewald, I think there are several issues here: 1. We
receive a lot of emails several times, even days later. PUSH messages are also
sent multiple times. If you are receiving both emails and Push messages several times it could because there are two simultaneous cron / scheduled tasks running processing the same messages queue. Could you check in your server cronjob configuration if you are executing the scheduled tasks several times? This usually happens also in cluster environments, when you have more than one server or when a system was migrated from one server to another but the cronjob was not deactivated. 2. Debugging: Unexpected response from the Airnotifier server: In this case what I feel is that the request failed because so many Push notifications were being processed at the same time for your site, it could be related to point 1 (duplicates emails and Push) Apart from that, I checked the Airnotifier server logs and I didn't see any recent critical error reported by the server. In any case, we are going to add additional debugging in the Airnotifier responses so we can improve debugging in general.

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Mobile 2 deployment and copyrights
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear All, I have successfully customised moodle mobile 2 app and connect to our moddle site. However when loaded the app to google app-store had the following notification from google: After review, your app has been suspended and removed from Google Play as a policy strike because it violates the impersonation policy. I appealed against this decision as far as I am aware moodle mobile app 2 is open sources. Could someone give me more information on this issue please. Many thanks Ayk

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile 2 deployment and copyrights
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, maybe you are using the word "Moodle" somewhere in your app name, description or config. xml settings. Please note that the word “Moodle” is trademarked internationally. Review https://moodle.com/trademarks/ Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile 2 deployment and copyrights
ResponsesInList.Text: I am using com.xxxxxx.moodlemobile as app name is that also not allowed ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile 2 deployment and copyrights
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, maybe not, I'm not sure but I suspect that Google has some automatic monitoring tools matching this kind of names Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile 2 deployment and copyrights
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Juan many thanks for quick reply. I think the initial rejection is computer generated reply due to use of maybe reserved names. I already appealed to this decision. I think what happens next is that some one from google team looks at the app and decides. I will publish the full outcome as soon as I receive a reply from them. Usually it takes 3 days. Many many thanks for your hard work and support Kindest Regards Ayk

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile 2 deployment and copyrights
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi All I received the following reply from Google. The copyrights issues is in relation to my institutional entity . They wanted to make we are who we say we are. " In order for us to process your appeal, please reply with verifiable documentation (PDF) with letterhead that your application is authorized. Or a proper legal license with a signed document from both parties." All the best Ayk

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 4.31 and PAGES Translation
ResponsesInList.Text: Do any existing 4.31 Moodle users successfully use the Moodle app to translate page content using existing Moodle core plugin? Multi language content filters are set to on for both content and headers. Everything works correctly in the web version. Things translate in the mobile version EXCEPT for pages. Any help appreciated. I don't know what build of mobile our contractor is using. Is there a mobile setting in the admin that would force pages to go through the translation filter?

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 4.31 and PAGES Translation
ResponsesInList.Text: Can you clarify what you mean by the 'Moodle Core' plugin - do you mean this one https://moodle.org/plugins/filter_translations or something else? If yes, then I spotted the same issue. We have given up on the above mechanism, as this along with various other issues made it not usable. Instead I use the {mlang} approach and this plugin https://moodle.org/plugins/filter_multilang2 I have written a few blog posts about Moodle translations, including a workable solution, that has recently come to frution: https://davefoord.wordpress.com/2024/09/24/the-different-ways-to-make-a-moodle-course-multi-lingual/ https://davefoord.wordpress.com/2025/03/24/why-there-is-still-a-need-to-properly-translate-moodle-based-learning-content/ https://davefoord.wordpress.com/2025/03/27/a-sustainable-way-to-provide-multi-lingual-moodle-courses/ Which may help?

ResponsesInList.Title: Mobile Moodle Course Content Upload
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I wish to upload full set of course content to Android device (Mobile Moodle App)  manually if possible offline. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mobile Moodle Course Content Upload
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ravishel, Unfortunately it's not possible to manually upload a course directly into the mobile devices. You have to first connect to the site and download the courses you need for every device where you want the course. Regards, Berta

ResponsesInList.Title: MoodleMobile2 custom not working with SSO Shibboleth
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Friends, I tried to setup custom Mobile App using the source code available on( https://github.com/moodlehq/moodlemobile2 ) and the guide https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Setting_up_your_development_environment_for_Moodle_Mobile_2 E verything ok with standard login but when i try shiboleth SSO  there is something wrong. My browser open new window (blank) with this url https://www.mymoodle.it/local/mobile/launch.php?service=local_mobile&passport=374.7395918660614 With the standard MoodleMobile2 application running fine. Thanks in advance. Angelo

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleMobile2 custom not working with SSO Shibboleth
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Angelo, login via the browser only works in Mobile devices, you cannot simulate it using Chrome/Chromium because there is no way for making them to support custom URL schemes. If you want to develop for the app, you should do the testing using normal user accounts. Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleMobile2 custom not working with SSO Shibboleth
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan, I tried my custom app on mobile devices but i have the same problem. Probably I have to set something else in my custom app... I followed your guide https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1HX5h7zwtay4amaY3qyLuCLfI7kQCiD9IoWuDH-lSa_0/edit#slide=id.ga20278994_0_111 to modify my custom app. Maybe I need to change the custom URL schemes on my app or on the plugin on my moodle site. Can You help me? Many Thanks Angelo

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleMobile2 custom not working with SSO Shibboleth
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, yes, there is a problem with custom apps using custom URL schemes for SSO, we've fixed a couple of issues in both the local_mobile plugin and the app. Basically, you have to change both the custom URL scheme in the local/mobile/launch.php file and in the app settings file (config.json). Recently we've changed that in the local_mobile so you don't have to modify the code, we added a new parameter in the plugin settings, but that will be all released at the end of this month so I may suggest you to wait. Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Best Slideshow Application for Moodle Mobile
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, all, I've recently added Moodle Mobile support to my site, to support some blended learning courses I've been teaching. It's been a great success and I can see attendees doing quizzes while commuting, etc. My existing Moodle site provides updated lecture slides by embedding PDF's, which I've noticed requires the PDF be downloaded and then viewed in the Android (in my own case) PDF viewer. I'm researching whether there are better options. I also use Google Slides and have experimented with embedding a Google Slides presentation into a test course - which worked well on the web, but the slides, which are embedded into a note on the course page, do not seem to be reachable on the app. Is this perhaps because they're on the course page? The text-only note above them appears just fine. What other applications are you using to make lecture slides available? --- Les

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Best Slideshow Application for Moodle Mobile
ResponsesInList.Text: Just updating my own post: A quick test has showed that creating a page to embed a Google Slides presentation does allow the presentation to show up in Moodle Mobile. With the phone held vertically, though, the slide is a bit on the small side, and the forward/play/back controls visible at the bottom of the presentation on the web are not there in the Mobile app. Turning the screen to landscape mode results in the slide filling the width of the screen, but now the bottom part of the slide is not visible and can't be scrolled into view. It looks spectacular when viewed in a desktop browser, though - and the ability to collaboratively edit a presentation and have the new version immediately reflected in Moodle is awfully attractive - no more 'print to PDF and upload ' sessions! --- Les

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Download moodle mobile
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, the moodlemobile2 repository you mention is the one used for development. It contains the code for the next release and it needs to be built using gulp in order to make it work. We have another repository used for publishing the apps: moodlemobile-phonegapbuild . This repository contains the code of the last release of the app, and it's already built in the build files. You can find more information in here . The version 3.2.0 of the app will work fine with Moodle 3.2. Moodle Mobile 3.2.0 will still work with older versions of Moodle, but you might lack some of the new features. Also, older versions of the app work with Moodle 3.2, but in this case you'll also lack the latest features of the app. So in order to have the maximum number of features we suggest to use the latest version of the app and Moodle. Kind regards, Dani
