ResponsesInList.Title: how to access to offline file path to play video? (Developer problem)
ResponsesInList.Text: hi this is simplified of my question. i can access to offline file via : <ion-button fill="clear" [core- download -file]="{fileurl: '<% urlout %>', timemodified: '1712408908'}" moduleId="64" courseId="3" component="mod_myOwnModule" [attr.aria-label]="'core.download' | translate"> <ion-icon name="cloud-download" slot="icon-only" aria-hidden="true"></ion-icon> </ion-button> in my plugin's .mustache, and i defined urlout in the mobile.php and this code work offline and online . if app is online ,then automatically use online use <% urlout %> and connect to server and if app i offline , then automatically try to show file via according mobile application. for example if my file is cartificate.pdf then open it via appropriate installed app in on my device. but my problem is: my file is a specific video that i want play in app and don't want open it by other android player. i want simply it play such as mod_file or mod_lable if video was downloaded. i use this code but only work app is online in .mustache: <ion-content overflow-scroll="true"> <video controls="controls" preload=" metadata " webkit-playsinline="webkit-playsinline" class="videoPlayer" id="video"> <source src="<% urlout %>" core-external-content component="mod_danehplayer" type="video/mp4" /> </video> </ion-content> how can i play a video that was downloaded in the offline mode? is there any example code? please note, my problem is not download a file for offline usage, i want play a video in the app in offline mode such as mod_resource or mod_lable.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how to access to offline file path to play video? (Developer problem)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I see you're adding the core-external-content directive to the "source", that directive should try to download the file in the following cases: If the size of the file is less than 20MB and the user is on WiFi, or if the file less than 2MB, it should be downloaded the first time it's rendered. If the file is bigger than that and the user is on WiFi, it should be downloaded in background the first time the user plays it. Please check that you fulfill any of those conditions. In the directive core-format-text we apply core-external-content automatically to all media elements, and in case of "source" elements we convert the "src" to "target-src", I guess we found a problem when using "src" directly (probably the video didn't detect the change of URL ). So if the video is not downloaded, you can try using [targetSrc]="'<% urlout %>'" instead of src (please notice there are single quotes inside double quotes. If this still doesn't work, you can try debugging the core-external-content directive to see why it isn't downloading the file. Or you can also try using core-format-text , but that means converting the video HTML to a string so it's better if core-external-content works properly without doing this. Cheers, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how to access to offline file path to play video? (Developer problem)
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks dani i use [src]="'<% urlout %>'" and problem solved and i can play video file in offline mode. it seems my problem was use not correct syntax. Another question if you can please advise me: if we want to make some content of video url (urlout) like decoding then play video but with this condition that decoded video is not saved in the device and only the encrypted file is saved in the device for offline mode what is best practice? i have some js code that can play my encoded video file from moodle server return [ 'templates' => [ [ 'id' => 'main', 'html' => $OUTPUT->render_from_template('mod_myownmodule/mobile_view_page', $data), ],

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how to access to offline file path to play video? (Developer problem)
ResponsesInList.Text: simplified of my need: how to access to read or write to local file in the android via JS that loaded from 'javascript' => .... in the moodle mobile app?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how to access to offline file path to play video? (Developer problem)
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi sadaf, one possible solution could be to use a URL in the app that downloads the decoded file already, so the file stored in the app wouldn't need to be decoded. But maybe you don't want to do that for security/privacy reasons. The first thing you need is the local path of the file, and you can obtain it using the CoreFilepoolProvider service in the Javascript code returned along with the template, in your classes/output/mobile.php. For example, you can use: 
```text
const url = 'THE URL OF THE FILE'; // If you don't have this URL in JS code, you can pass it to JS using otherdata and this.CONTENT_OTHERDATA.
```
 
```text
const path = await this.CoreFilepoolProvider.getFilePathByUrl(this.CoreSitesProvider.getCurrentSiteId(), url);
```
 With this code you will have the path of the file. Please notice that the file needs to be downloaded, if the file isn't downloaded you should either use the online URL or you can force downloading the file using 
```text
this.CoreFilepoolProvider.downloadUrl(this.CoreSitesProvider.getCurrentSiteId(), url)
```
 This function will download the file if needed, and then return the path. Once you have the path, you can read the file. Maybe the fetch function will work for local files too, but we usually use: 
```text
this.CoreFileProvider.readFile(path, format);
```
 Where format is 0 for text, 1 for data URL, 2 for binary string and 3 for array buffer. Looking at your code, I guess you want to use format=3. I hope this helps. Cheers, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how to access to offline file path to play video? (Developer problem)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dani worked thanks a lot ♥🌹

ResponsesInList.Title: Remove progress bar and % from free Moodle Mobile app?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, I've done my best to search for the answer to this one, but we are stuck and it's rather urgent. We need to have Activity Completion in one of our New Student Orientation courses for the Instructors to use behind-the-scenes. We do *not* want the students to see the progress of their course or % on their dashboards. I was able to remove it from the web, but we cannot figure out how to hide it on Moodle. We are on Moodle 3.8 and using the free version of Moodle Mobile 3.9.2. I can see Course completion from this page: Administration / Mobile app / Mobile features and have tried to disable this feature, but I guess I can only do one at a time? And it seems to make no difference. Does anyone have any ideas? Thanks, Bobby

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Remove progress bar and % from free Moodle Mobile app?
ResponsesInList.Text: I'll add to my post in case this is a better question: We have a site using Restrict Access based upon groups for viewing resources and doing activities . A student in one group is completing all of the available activities, but the course completion is telling them they are not complete. We think this is because that can't get to the content we have prevented them from seeing. Is there a way to have Completion Tracking respect what we have set through Restrict Access? Otherwise, I have to get this progress bar turned off for the students. We used the CSS trick in the browser, but the app is showing it and alarming the students. Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Remove progress bar and % from free Moodle Mobile app?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Bobby, unfortunately the only way to hide the progress bar in the app without changing Moodle core code is with a remote theme (CSS), but that feature is only available for Premium sites. The "Course completion" disabled feature only hides the Course Completion tab in the tabs at the top of the course, but the progress bar is still displayed. It basically hides what in web is displayed in the Course Completion block. In case you're interested, here you'll find more info about the plans: https://apps.moodle.com/local/apps/ Cheers, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Remove progress bar and % from free Moodle Mobile app?
ResponsesInList.Text: For posterity: we finally resolved this by signing up for the Premium app. I created a {moodle root}/local/mobile.css file and referenced it with the mobilecssurl setting. Because there's no real documentation on how to target specific components and the example themes do not discuss the progress bar, I had to repeatedly rename the URL by appending a version hash "#1" "#2" etc to it to keep trying new CSS approaches. It seemed like you also had to log out and back in to see the fresh styles. Finally, this CSS worked: .core-progress-bar progress, .core-progress-text { display: none !important; } I'm not sure how much of that is necessary but this was the first thing that actually worked. The Moodle Mobile Themes doc is useful but doesn't list all the components or how target them with selectors, so I looked at the mobile app's github repo to figure that out.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, it's not possible to add a Google login button inside the Moodle Mobile app itself. The only way to do that would be to create your own version of the app. If you configure the login via browser, this is how the authentication is done in the app: The user introduces you site URL in the app. The app opens a browser or embedded browser with your Moodle site. ResponsesInList.Title: Inapp browser auto-login moodle mobile 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: How enable the inapp browser auto-login in moodle mobile app v3.2

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Inapp browser auto-login moodle mobile 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Devendiran, there are some restrictions to make auto-login work: The Moodle site needs to be 3.2 or higher. It doesn't work in previous Moodle sites. Your site needs to use SSL (https). After fulfilling the previous conditions, you should invalidate all tokens so the users create a new one. I think the easiest way is to go to the external_tokens table in your Moodle database and modify the value of " validuntil ". Also, please take into account that a certain user can only auto-login every 6 minutes (for security reasons). Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Inapp browser auto-login moodle mobile 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Dani, I'm enable the ssl (https) , external in-app browser auto login work , but agin proplem is click back button and open another external browser link again ask user name & password.. Kind regards, Deva

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Inapp browser auto-login moodle mobile 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Devendiran, the in-app browser and the system browser use a different session. This means that authenticating in one of them won't affect the other. If you auto-login in in-app browser you'll have to wait 6 minutes to be able to auto-login in the system browser. Once authenticated in the system browser, the session should be kept for future requests. Also, we detected that in some devices the in-app browser session is resetted when it's closed, so in that case the auto-login will only work once every 6 minutes in in-app browser. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Inapp browser auto-login moodle mobile 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Inapp browser auto-login moodle mobile 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello There, One thing to note that Site admins cannot use this feature. So be careful to test the feature with a regular user. Bests Yusuf

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Inapp browser auto-login moodle mobile 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: i didnot understand , what is mean by inappbrowser. i have some guess 1. link "Website" in menu (which is by default) 2. link appeared in custom menu if we choose Custom menu items as "InappBrowser" from moodleweb mobile features 3. link appeared in custom menu if we choose Custom menu items as "embedded "from moodleweb mobile features because neither of three option has autologin feature encountered with me. i m using moodlecloud and moodlemobile 3.3.1 clear me if i am wrong thanks in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Inapp browser auto-login moodle mobile 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, when you create a custom menu item you have 3 options: browser: the page is opened in the system's browser (Chrome, Safari, Firefox , ...). inappbrowser: the page is opened in a "popup" (browser embedded in the app). The app opens a new window, like a popup, inside the app itself. You need to close this inappbrowser to be able to use the app again since it overlays the whole app. embedded: the page is opened inside the app itself, using an iframe. This is not a browser, it's similar to opening a SCORM . The first 2 options, browser and inappbrowser, support auto-login. The third one, embedded, doesn't support it right now, we have an open issue to fix it: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MOBILE-2161 Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Inapp browser auto-login moodle mobile 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, the app should try to auto-login you if you open a custom menu item that points to the same site you have in the app, you don't need to do anything special. Please notice auto-login has some limitation, e.g. it doesn't work for admins, the site needs to use https and you need to wait a certain time between auto-login requests for each user. Cheers, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Inapp browser auto-login moodle mobile 3.2

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Inapp browser auto-login moodle mobile 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sebastian, there are only 2 ways to authenticate a user: Entering the username and password (this gives you the user token). Using the user token (obtained in the step above). To achieve what you want to do, you should manually create a token for the user (Site administration > Plugins > Web services > Manage tokens) and use that token to authenticate the user in a custom app , the official app doesn't support this. Please notice that this is really insecure since anyone with the token can access your site as that user. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Render default layout in Course Format Plugin (Mobile Support)
Re: Render default layout in Course Format Plugin (Mobile Support)
ResponsesInList.Text: I've spent quite a bit of time looking at how possible it is to re-use the core course format code for a custom format, and the simple answer is that you can't, aside from being able to use ionic and some core components and directives.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Render default layout in Course Format Plugin (Mobile Support)
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Mark, I've been trying to do the same and failed with most part of the code so I guessed it's not possible. I'll have to rebuild the core course format with PHP and then mustache as u mentioned in another thread also. What I still don't get is, why the Delegate CoreCourseFormatDelegate has those options canviewallsections displaysectionselector when the selector will never show anyway when using the Delegate and having to render the template ourself?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Render default layout in Course Format Plugin (Mobile Support)
ResponsesInList.Text: I was wondering this too.  I've just worked out that this controls whether the section selector is available through the menu at the top-right of the course page (which also has options for enabling section downloads, downloading the whole course, and viewing the course summary).  This is separate from the template you provide for your course format. Presumably selecting a section here (if its enabled) will set selectedSection in the javascript data that's available to your template.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Render default layout in Course Format Plugin (Mobile Support)
ResponsesInList.Text:
A bit of an update on this, while you can't just reuse the whole template, you can reuse the core-course-module component which can save you a lot of time.  This very basic example will give you a list of all the course modules from all sections , you can copy more from the core-course-format component's template in the app if you want. 
```text
    <ng-container *ngFor="let section of sections">


            <ng-container *ngFor="let module of section.modules">


                <core-course-module *ngIf="module.visibleoncoursepage !== 0" [module]="module" [courseId]="course.id" [downloadEnabled]="downloadEnabled" (completionChanged)="onCompletionChanged()"></core-course-module>


            </ng-container>


    </ng-container>
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle mobile not accepting custom url
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi, if you check the console, the first error it's showing is: TypeError: Cannot read property 'errorcode' of null This is because the app expects to receive errors as JSON objects (that's how the login/token.php script works). But it is receiving a string instead: "
Error: Internal script failure
". Since the app is receiving a value that doesn't expect, it fails and then it tries to connect again modifying the URL. When you enter a site URL, the app will always do this: Try to connect using https. If it fails, try to connect using https and adding or removing www. If it fails, try to connect using http. If it fails, try to connect using http and adding or removing www. Please fix that error (Internal script failure) and try again. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Text: Ah, I think I misunderstood. You're loading your moodle website inside a webview in an app? This forum is about developing the Moodle app . ResponsesInList.Title: Changes in Moodle Mobile release process
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, we've made some changes in the Moodle Mobile release process: Frequency: Until now we were releasing a new version per month (some months we released two versions). In order to make the release process more sustainable and to improve our Q&A process, we will be releasing new versions every two months starting soon (probably when Moodle 3.1 is released). The plan will be to release new versions at the same time (same week) that new major or minor Moodle versions are released. Versioning: Once we start releasing along Moodle, we’ll align Moodle version numbers with the Moodle Mobile ones. Once Moodle 3.1 is released, we’ll release Moodle Mobile 3.1.0. Every time minor Moodle versions are released we’ll increase the last digit so, for example, when Moodle 3.1.1 is out, we’ll release Moodle Mobile 3.1.1. The second digit will be increased when Moodle major versions are released. Hopefully, this will avoid confusions with the version numbering between Moodle and Moodle Mobile. Emergency releases: In some cases, we’ll need to release a new version at a different time than a Moodle one. When this happens, we will increase the last digit too.

ResponsesInList.Title: How to develop a plugin with file upload support ?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Moodlers, we are developing a plugin with mobile support which would let students upload PDF files. Could you please point me the direction to understand how to handle file uploading within the mobile app? The Moodle App Plugins Development Guide mentions a CoreFileUploaderDelegate but without more information. I would be interested to know which parts of the Moodle code we could have a look at for inspiration. Thank you ! Wiktor

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to develop a plugin with file upload support ?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there, The delegate you mention would be used if you need to add support for new types of files, but if you only need to upload a file it shouldn't be necessary to add a new handler. In your case, you should be able to upload files using existing services. In particular, I'd suggest that you look into src/core/features/fileuploader . From plugins, you have access to most services. You can see which ones are available looking at src/core/features/compile/services/compile.ts . For example, it is importing `CORE_FILEUPLOADER_SERVICES` which exposes `CoreFileUploaderProvider` , `CoreFileUploaderHelperProvider` and `CoreFileUploaderDelegateService` . If you want to see how these services are used in the app, I'd suggest that you clone the source code of the app and search for usages. If you want to understand the codebase of the app better, I'd suggest that you read the Moodle App Development Guide . You don't need to read this to develop plugins, but if you're working on a use-case that is not explicitly documented in the plugins guide, you'll probably have to dig into the source code and it will be useful to understand it. Also, check out this previous post in the forum about a similar topic: Taking a Picture / File Upload from Moodle App in custom plugin .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to develop a plugin with file upload support ?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks a lot Noel, we will have a closer look at the resources you kindly shared.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle mobile app has no "turn editing on"... why?
ResponsesInList.Text: The Moodle Mobile app works through web services. To add full editing would require the creation of new web services which is fairly complex. My advice is that creating full editing for Moodle mobile would be enormously complex  and too difficult for a student project. Plus the benefit would be not significant as mobile devices are not ideal for editing content. For a student it would make more sense to investigate the creation of an editing feature for a specific feature or plugin. One of the advantages of this is that understanding web services in Moodle would give you an understanding of technologies that are very widely used outside Moodle. This page might help with your investigations https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Moodle_Mobile

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle mobile app has no "turn editing on"... why?

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, unfortunately this authentication method is not enabled in the app. In order to fix that, you need to install this additional plugin: https://docs.moodle.org/29/en/Moodle_Mobile_additional_features And enable login via browser (in the plugin settings), see the previous docs for detailed steps Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Mobile 3.1.3 released
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi all, Moodle Mobile 3.1.3 is now available in the Android store and it should be available in a few of days in the iOs app store. Improvements in this version: The majority of app features now work offline - creating a
message, adding a course note, completing a choice, completing a survey,
creating a new forum post, creating a new wiki page and completing an
assignment Courses should load faster due to several performance improvements Forum threads can be displayed with the oldest or newest first Complete release notes here: https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Moodle_Mobile_3.1.3_release_notes Regards, Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Bootstrap in Moodle web site and MMA
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I'm trying to build a Page activity using Bootstrap components (since they are available in Moodle 3.5). I noticed that they are not supported by the mobile app instead, the app just renders basic HTML tags. Is there any components library  (HTML/ CSS /JS) that is supported on both the web site and the mobile app? If not, is there a way to reference styles and scripts into a course so that the mobile app will also use them, and render HTML components as Bootstrap or any other? Many thanks for help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Bootstrap in Moodle web site and MMA
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi! Since Ionic and Bootstrap css can have conflicts between
them we cannot fully support bootstrap classes on Ionic. However we're
going to add more and more support to specific classes in a near
future. Please follow the following issues to keep up with this topic: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MOBILE-2395 https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MOBILE-2091 Ionic mobile components can be found on https://ionicframework.com/docs/components/ but they are not supported on website. Some bootstrap components are supported on mobile but we're working on adding more of them. Cheers, Pau

ResponsesInList.Title: Announcements/news items in front page of mobile app?
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi, In moodle we can have the "Latest Announcements" block on the front page which displays a certain number of announcements specific in your front page settings ("Number of Announcements | newsitems"). But I'm unsure if this is supposed to work in the mobile app. I know it's a block, which is apparently not yet supported in moodle mobile. But the code for the mobile app front page contains this section: 
```text
        <!-- Site home items: news, categories, courses, etc. -->
        <ng-container *ngIf="items.length > 0">
            <ion-item-divider *ngIf="section && section.hasContent"></ion-item-divider>
            <ng-container *ngFor="let item of items">
                <core-sitehome-all-course-list class="item" *ngIf="item == 'all-course-list'"></core-sitehome-all-course-list>
                <core-sitehome-categories  *ngIf="item == 'categories'"></core-sitehome-categories>
                <core-sitehome-course-search *ngIf="item == 'course-search'"></core-sitehome-course-search>
                <core-sitehome-enrolled-course-list *ngIf="item == 'enrolled-course-list'"></core-sitehome-enrolled-course-list>
                <core-sitehome-news *ngIf="item == 'news'"></core-sitehome-news>
            </ng-container>
        </ng-container>
```
 The item <core-sitehome-news> seems to be intended for announcements, but none of our announcements are showing up in the app. So what's going on there?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Announcements/news items in front page of mobile app?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Grayson The "Latest Announcements" block isn't supported in Moodle Mobile App. We are working on giving support to some specific blocks (including "Latest Announcements"). Bear in mind that we estimate it to be included in 3.7.1 version for the App, which is estimated to be released in time 3 - 4 months after 3.7.0 is released. We estimate to release 3.7. 0 version for the App in 2 - 3 weeks. Kind regards, Isabel

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Re: Announcements/news items in front page of mobile app?
ResponsesInList.Text: I see. So is that element just placeholder code, or is it supposed to be doing something in this version?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Re: Announcements/news items in front page of mobile app?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Grayson, just to clarify things, "sites news or 'Latest announcements' are supported in the "Site home" when is configured to show within the main page, not like a block. If you choose in the "Front page settings" to display the "latest announcements" you will see a link that will open the forum for the "Site home". But, if you add the "'Latest announcements'" block in both "Site home" or the " Dashboard " it won't be displayed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Blocks or other non-activity plugins in Mobile?
ResponsesInList.Text: I noticed that several core blocks (e.g. "Course overview", "Timeline") are available in the mobile app. Is there information somewhere about adding mobile support to blocks or other plugins? I know that activity plugins are documented, but what about others? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Blocks or other non-activity plugins in Mobile?
ResponsesInList.Text: I can see a reference to possible block support here - https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Mobile_support_for_plugins#CoreBlockDelegate Are there any examples?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Blocks or other non-activity plugins in Mobile?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mike, blocks in the app are quite new. In the current version (3.7.0) they're only supported in Site Home and Dashboard , in the next release (3.7.1) they'll also be supported in the course page. So I'm not sure if anyone has already used that delegate and have an example, maybe the guys in the OU.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleMobile2 When tap on push notification of a message, blank screen
ResponsesInList.Text: HI Yusuf, I understand that you are using a custom app, have you tried the official one? are you getting the same error if you receive notifications in the official app? ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleMobile2 When tap on push notification of a message, blank screen

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MoodleMobile2 When tap on push notification of a message, blank screen
ResponsesInList.Text: I have resolved the issue. The problem was I sync the master branch and rebased my local branch onto latest commit not the version 3.1.2 tag (release). Somewhere in the code, there is a problem causing the issue. I have rebased to the v.3.1.2 tag and tested. It is working. I just want to give  a information in case of effecting for the future version 3.1.3  of app. Best Yusuf

ResponsesInList.Title: Splitting courses semester wise in moodle mobile custom application
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I've customized the moodle mobile application successfully in apcahe cordova environment. I need one change i want to split courses in semester wise. Course full name, short name and course id are retrieving from server . How can i retrieve course creation date so that i can split courses using  creation date. If there are another ways to solve this than your help will be appreciated. Thanks, Awais Mushtaq

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Splitting courses semester wise in moodle mobile custom application
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Awais, please check the WebService core_course_get_courses. You send a list of IDs and it returns those courses, but I think you need to be enrolled in all of them in order to make it work, you should check it. Each course should have a startdate attribute that contains the date when the course starts.  I think the timecreated attribute is only visible for teachers, so you cannot see it as a student. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: customize Moodle App
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Isabel, Moodle HQ provides a service, via certified Moodle Partners, where the Apps team can customise the app for anyone who needs it including the Push notifications (Airnotifier) service management. This service helps fund the improvement of the Moodle app in general. More information: https://moodle.com/branded-app/ , if you have any questions there is a contact form at the end of that page. Regards, Isabel Renedo Moodle Apps Team

ResponsesInList.Title: Data sync between web application & mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Team, I have few questions in my mind, How will the branded app connects to the database ? what is the frequency data gets synced in both web application & Moodle app? Will mobile app also have local db in place for the data storage? Thanks in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Data sync between web application & mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, the Moodle app communicates with the server using WebServices . So for example when the user opens the "My courses" page, we call the appropriate WebServices to retrieve that info. The app has a cache system (using a local database) to avoid calling the server too often. So for example if a user opens a certain course several times in a short time, the first time the app will perform a request to the server to obtain the latest data but the following requests will use the data that is already stored in the device. This system is the one that allows the app to work in offline. The "valid time" of the information depends of the WebService (whether the data retrieved can change often or not), and it can go from 7 minutes to 18 hours. In general there is no synchronization system to keep this information up to date, it will be updated the next time the user opens the page in online and the data is no longer "valid". When a user tries to create/edit/delete something in offline and the app allows it, we store the data in a local database to be sent when the user is connected. There are several factors that can impact how often we try to send the offline data to the server, the app usually waits 5 - 15 minutes between retries (e.g. if the server is down). So yes, the app has a local db to store the data (it uses sql ite). Cheers, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Data sync between web application & mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank for the details info

ResponsesInList.Title: Number of sessions (app)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I would like to know the number of sessions (or logging) that are done through Moodle Mobile (app). Through the table “M_LOGSTORE_STANDARD_LOG” I cannot find enough information to discern if they are made by desktop or by the app. I have also seen that the tables “M_EXTERNAL_*” are there (EXTERNALSERVICEID = 1). However, I imagine that should be an easier relation than going to query “M_LOGSTORE_STANDARD_LOG” + ACTION = 'loggedin'. Isn't it? (I don't know) Also, I would like to know the type of device of each session, but I imagine that this information can be obtained by crossing it with the table “M_USER_DEVICES”, is it true? I would be very grateful if you could help me... thank you very much. The Moodle version is 3.8.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Number of sessions (app)
ResponsesInList.Text: The Moodle app users are permanently logged-in (until the authentication token expires, default duration is around 3 months) this is why is not easy to detect user sessions. My recommendation would be to check the lastmodified field of the external_tokens table, it indicates the last time a user accessed via the mobile app (or web services), you should be storing this data periodically, for example, everyday 30 minutes calculate the last access per user and then consolidate the data.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle mobile works but Moodle Desktop doesnt
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jason, this may happen because the Windows version expect a perfect formatted response from the server (we didn't do that, is because the underlying technology used) Please, send me via private message your site url so I can check

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle mobile works but Moodle Desktop doesnt
ResponsesInList.Text: Just a follow-up, after receiving the URL I confirmed that is a problem (the token.php is returning a weird error). As I said in my original post, the underlying technology of the desktop version will make the desktop app stop working because it expects a JSON response and not a standard Moodle error (and it's nothing we can't control) This was recently reported in MOBILE-2375 So, in order to fix this, you need to go the Moodle FAQ, https://docs.moodle.org/34/en/Moodle_Mobile_FAQ#I_can.27t_get_the_app_to_work._What_can_I_do.3F , and check one by one all the possible errors. In this case it seems you are using an authentication plugin badly configured (or a non-core authentication plugin), so check points 2 and 3.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi y h, You have to check  can downloaded files in your moodle for particular web service . go to administration->webservices->external webservice->then edit your service ->click on show more link then check can downloaded files.

ResponsesInList.Title: Invalid value respond detected - REST mod_quiz_get_quizzes_by_categories
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I tried accesing data via Postman. Apparently i’m not gettjng  any data. The error as per subject, appears when there are quiz data in a course. Before we added, courses were enroled by user was 0 and it was no problem to get the result of the transaction. What can we do to address this issue
role: Picture of Sufian Khairi Ahmad Maulana

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Invalid value respond detected - REST mod_quiz_get_quizzes_by_categories
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sufian, are you able to debug the request using the browser development tools or Postman? If so you can follow this guide to get a better error message: https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Moodle_Mobile_debugging_WS_requests Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Invalid value respond detected - REST mod_quiz_get_quizzes_by_categories
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes I did manage to get more details from the link you gave. But it doesn't make sense as the variable required says the following: quizzes => Invalid response value detected: autosaveperiod => Invalid response value detected: Invalid external api response: the value is \"\", the server was expecting \"int\" type" By right i should have return me a list of quiz, eventho i didn't specify any value to courseids[0]. How do I specify the value to this variable? I don't understand how to use this.
role: Picture of Sufian Khairi Ahmad Maulana

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Invalid value respond detected - REST mod_quiz_get_quizzes_by_categories
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, login as admin in Moodle and go to this page: Site administration > Plugins > Activity modules > Quiz In there you'll find a setting with name autosaveperiod. I guess that setting is empty in your site, it should contain a number (the default value is "1 minutes").

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I have enabled Oauth2 in moodle. On using the mobile application I get the message "You need to log in to the site in a browser window" (OK). After login it takes me back to mobile application and same message appears again (instead of login). No I again press OK button and browser window launches (self authenticates) and then mobile application goes to "My Course" section and I get the same message  again . At this point i am login to mobile app and every thing works. It should ask for login only once. Thanks in advance. Regards, Asad

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Asad, what plugin are you using for Oauth2? Have you tried to use the embedded browser setting instead the normal browser one? Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan, I am using "Moodle Mobile additional features" https://docs.moodle.org/31/en/Moodle_Mobile_additional_features#Installation the video at only asks for login once but in my case it appears 3 times Embedded browser is not working and I use "Via browser window". Version of Moodle is 3.2. Every things goes fine except receiving multiple logins in browser. Regards, Asad

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Asad, sorry for the delay in answering. Which version of the app do you have installed? You can check it in App Settings > About . Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dani, Thanks for the reply. I am  using node v0.12.7 as recommended in https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Setting_up_your_development_environment_for_Moodle_Mobile_2 and version of Moodle is 3.2 App Settings are as Follows: Moodle Mobile: 2.8 Apache : 2.0 Version Name : 2.8 Version Code: 2009 Cordova Version: 5.1.0 Cordova Device Platform: Android Regards, Asad

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Asad, you should update the app version, we did some fixes a while ago to those modals. The latest release is version 3.2.0. I guess you're building a custom app , so you should rebase your changes against the master branch of the moodlemobile2 repository. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dani, I also downloaded official app from android play store and it was also stuck on mm.login.authenciate.  I closed the app and opened again then after login it worked. Looks like issue while making sessions or getting token from the browser window for the first time. Thanks, Asad

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: I am using OAuth for login

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Asad, can you send me a test account to mobile@moodle.com so I can reproduce the problem and check what is happening? I need the Moodle URL , username and password. I'll try it with the Moodle Mobile app. Thank you, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dani, The site URL is " http://moodle.dvrdns.org ". Is your email "mobile@moodle.com" linked with google apps? The reason I am asking is that you will not need to enter user and password, you will have to allow in OAuth and your email address is now allowed to login to the site.  There is a button named "Login with Google" after you provide site in mobile app. Thanks, Asad

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Asad, I just tried it. The first time I authenticated, when I had to authorize my GApps account, your site added a hash to the end of the launch URL for some reason. Moodle launches the app with a URL like this: $urlscheme://token=$apptoken In this case, there was a hash (#) at the end of the URL. The app doesn't expect that, so it failed and it left an "Authenticating" modal shown forever. I opened an issue to handle this: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MOBILE-2072 I restarted the app and I authenticated again, and then it worked fine everytime I tried. I've never seen multiple confirmations. In which device are you testing this? Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dani, Thank you very much Dani for you your help and creating issue for this. Multiple confirmation was with an older version of the app (APP: 2.8).  With latest version  (APP: 3.2.1) it is only once (stuck) while adding a new account / site. Also one more thing recommended version of node is v0.12.7 as mentioned at https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Setting_up_your_development_environment_for_Moodle_Mobile_2 , and while compiling it gives deprecated  warning, is there any chance in future we will be updating node version? Best Regards, Asad

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Asad, we have an issue for updating Node, it is currently waiting for integration. It should land soon! https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MOBILE-1796 Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Oauth2 multiple time confirmation
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you again Dani Best Regards, Asad

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Setting up environment for Mobile Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, first time I see an error like this :S The app requires node 6 and it seems you are using node 8, maybe that's the problem

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Setting up environment for Mobile Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the reply, Juan, and I'm glad I'm able to show you something new! You are absolutely right, I downgraded node.js to 6.9.1 and I've manage to progress to square 1! Now, I need to show the app in my browser ...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to set up development environment
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jaco, If you've got a lot of terminal output to share, it's best to use a service like PrivateBin and share the URL in your post. Otherwise you create a very long page which makes it hard for people who might help you to navigate the thread.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to set up development environment
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jaco, please make sure that you have installed this plugin: cordova-android-support-gradle-release Please use the version 2.0.1 of that plugin, there were some changes in Android recently that break the build system. Also, please make sure to use the version 7.1.2 for the Android platform. So I recommend you to run: cordova platform remove android cordova plugin remove cordova-android-support-gradle-release cordova platform add android@7.1.2 cordova plugin add cordova-android-support-gradle-release@2.0.1 Cheers, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unexpected response from Airnotifier Server in Moodle 3.3
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, in 3.2 we introduce some debugging in the notifications preference so maybe this error was always there but you've started to notice it right now. Can you check if you are using the Airnotifier version indicated here? https://docs.moodle.org/33/en/Mobile_app_notifications#Installing_your_own_notifications_infrastructure Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: moodle app issue
ResponsesInList.Text: I have connected the moodle app to the site which I am currently working on and do not want to display site home however if I select multiple otions in the Disabled features list this is still visible after sync, if I just have the site home selected in the Disabled features list then this works.  Is there a way to get the site home not to display whilst selecting multiple items here as this is the requirement of my client. Thanks Scott

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: moodle app issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scott If you are using the standard Moodle app and the Moodle site hasn't got a Moodle Plan associated, then only 1 disabled features is available for that site. Please see https://apps.moodle.com/ for more details. Regards, Isabel

ResponsesInList.Title: Source code of Play Store app
ResponsesInList.Text: I am working with hybrid app phonegap source code from https://github.com/moodlehq/moodlemobile-phonegapbuild . I hope this is the one compiled and hosted as APK in playstore.!! Someone please confirm. We are working on customizing this app for our organizational needs. Thanks .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Source code of Play Store app
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Muthu, yes, this is the code used to release in Google Play and the App Store. Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Problems accessing Moodle Mobile with SSO CAS authentication
ResponsesInList.Text: Good Morning, I need a little more information on the problem that is presented to me. I have a Moodle 3.1.6 platform configured for a multi-authentication, since I have as main method of authentication against SSO CAS and the possibility of access through certain manual accounts. So far so good. The problem arises when you want to use the Moodle Mobile app with these settings. To begin, according to the documentation, if you have CAS authentication you have to install a plugin "Additional Features of Moodle Mobile" in which among other things configure the type of login: Through the APP Using a built-in browser (for SSO plugins) Via a browser window (for SSO connectors) I install and configure it, both with option 2 and option 3. But it behaves in the following way, not being the expected behavior: I access the app on iOS, enter the URL where I want to connect. It opens a browser embedded as I configured it above, where it shows me the screen of multiidentification (users cas and users not cas). I select CAS user, and it takes me to CAS authentication. I authenticate, and the problem comes when I access the platform, it is as if I continue in the embedded browser, not having the appearance of the APP Moodle Mobile (orange appearance) but the appearance of the platform as I see it on a desktop PC . On the other hand, in another node that uses tests, same version 3.1.6, with the same configuration of multi-identification (CAS + manual), if I do not install the plugin "Additional Features of Moodle Mobile", and access to the app Moodle Mobile with a user with a manual account, returns me to the moodle mobile app with its appearance and the functionalities that can be configured. If I login with a CAS user it gives me an error. How can I solve this? Or is the issue of Multi-Identification a problem to make use of this APP? Thank you very much in advance.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: All Users in Site Can Use Moodle App
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Muhammad, There are no limitations on the number of students using the Moodle App. The Moodle App is used by big institutions, including universities. Regarding the number of active devices for mobile push notifications, this is the number of user devices actively receiving push notifications from the site (calculated monthly). Moodle Free Plan up to 50 active devices for push notifications Moodle Pro Plan up to 500 active devices for push notifications Moodle Premium Plan unlimited active devices for push notifications Kind regards, Isabel

ResponsesInList.Title: Plugin: com.phonegap.plugins.PushPlugin error
ResponsesInList.Text:
When building the current version of MoodleMobile2 using <ionic build ios> I get the following error: 
```text
The following build commands failed:


CompileC build/Customer\ ODS.build/Debug-iphonesimulator/Customer\ ODS.build/Objects-normal/i386/PushPlugin.o Customer\ ODS/Plugins/com.phonegap.plugins.PushPlugin/PushPlugin.m normal i386 objective-c com.apple.compilers.llvm.clang.1_0.compiler
```
 I tried opening the iOS project in Xcode to see if I could get it to build there, but received a failure as well. It points to the file PushPlugin.m with the following error on line 221: 
```text
No visible @interface for 'UIView' declares the selector 'stringByEvaluatingJavaScriptFromString:'
```
 When I checked the plugin's GitHub page is says it is now deprecated. Should this plugin be replaced with the new version https://github.com/phonegap/phonegap-plugin-push ? If not, how can i solve this issue? Any tips appreciated. Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Plugin: com.phonegap.plugins.PushPlugin error
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jeremy, you can try to remove the plugin from the project and add it again, sometimes re-installing thing fix this kind of issues. If you haven't done any manual change to the iOS project you can try to re-install the platform too. About the deprecated plugin, we've known it for a while but we didn't use the new version because it's not supported by ngCordova. It's been a while though, so maybe we should change the plugin and use its API instead of ngCordova. Cheers, Dani

Meanwhile, you can just go back to a previous version of the iOS platform (3.9.1 is working for me) or maybe try this fork of the plugin that seems to include some bug fixes: https://github.com/Telerik-Verified-Plugins/PushNotification I created this issue to fix it in our repo: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MOBILE-1494 Kind regards, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Concern Regarding Local Storage of Files and SCREENRECORDING in Moodle Mobile App
ResponsesInList.Text: We are currently using the Moodle application and uploading SCORM packages and other learning materials (such as posters) by storing them in an S3 bucket and serving them directly through Moodle. However, we have observed that when users log in to the Moodle application through our website, the data (SCORM packages and other uploaded files) is being stored locally on the Android device under the following path: /data/com.moodle.moodlemobile/sites/filepool/ This behavior results in the entire content being saved on the user's phone storage. Could you please confirm if this is the default functionality of the Moodle mobile app? If so, is there any configuration or setting available to restrict or disable this local caching behavior, especially for SCORM packages and media files? Second question is can we restrict Screenrecording and Screenshot in moodle application We would like to ensure that sensitive content is not permanently stored on user devices for security and copyright reasons.

ResponsesInList.Title: Concern Regarding Local Storage of Files and SCREENRECORDING in Moodle Mobile App
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Abhishek, Notice that in order to be able to play packages offline, the app will have to download the SCORM zip to the user's device. In order to prevent this behaviour, you can enable the global SCORM setting "Protect package downloads" ( protectpackagedownloads ). Enabling the previous setting will disable the offline mode for the SCORM activity. > Second question is can we restrict Screenrecording and Screenshot in moodle application This can only be achieved by building your own version of the mobile app to be able to change by code this behaviour. Kind regards, Isabel

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle Mobile Notifications review
ResponsesInList.Text: Anyone has any experience to share with regards to Moodle Mobile with Notifications ( AirNotifier) turned on. I would be really interested to know if you are big institution and if you have faced any issues working with notifications for your Moodle instance. This could either be connecting to your custom Air Notifier server or routing via messages. moodle.net . Is there a queuing system already in Moodle where if a personal message is sent between users it is queued somewhere before it is pushed out to AirNotifier and the relevant Messaging cloud service ( GCM or APNS)  or is everything sent in one go ? Appreciate that one user interacting with the system wouldn't put too much load on the system but a couple of hundred users interacting and are waiting to receive their notifications ? I know for a fact that when you download the generic Moodle mobile app from play stores it by default connects to messages.moodle.net if you have the Access Key so it must be quite robust in handling all the moodle sites around the world ?! Many thanks for your help Hittesh Ahuja

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Mobile Notifications review
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, right now there is no queue, everything works on the go. Airnotifier doesn't require a lot of hardware, our instance works very well in a normal virtual server. Regards, Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Scenarios for response codes on Moodle Mobile Additional Features plugin check.php
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan, Thanks for your work on the local_mobile plugin. Can you help me understand what scenarios could cause a response... {"error":0,"code":"2"} Using / local/mobile/check.php?service=local_mobile I'm trying to understand the response errors for the Moodle Mobile Additional Features plugin http://examplenoodlesite.com/ local/mobile/check.php?service=local_mobile When configured properly: {"error":0,"code":"1"} When plugin installed but not-enabled: {"error":1,"code":3} Do you know what scenarios cause the following response? {"error":0,"code":"2"} Thanks, Anthony

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scenarios for response codes on Moodle Mobile Additional Features plugin check.php
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Anthony, there is no {"error":0,"code":"2"} scenario, we used {"error":0,"code":"1"} for saying that everything was ok so I can use further OK codes error:0, code: 2 etc.. in the future for describing specific configurations or settings that may be required in the bootstrap phase. So basically, right now, error:0 means everything ok, but in the future the code may change to reflect some specific settings/configurations Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scenarios for response codes on Moodle Mobile Additional Features plugin check.php
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan, Thanks for your reply. Our client site was returning that unusual response code, so I needed to do some more digging. I found out what setting returns. {"error":0,"code":"2"} I've documented it incase others find it helpful. Change Site Administration > Plugins > Local Plugins > Moodle Mobile additional features : Switch Type of Login to "Via a browser window (for SSO plugins)" Test: http://yourmoodlesite.com/local/mobile/check.php?service=moodle_mobile This will return: ``` {"error":0,"code":"2"} ``` If select Type of Login: "Via the app" Test: http://yourmoodlesite.com/local/mobile/check.php?service=moodle_mobile returns... ``` {"error":0,"code":"1"} ``` The back-porting of the web services api in the MM additional features plugin is very useful. Your team's work on this is much appreciated. Thanks, Anthony

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scenarios for response codes on Moodle Mobile Additional Features plugin check.php
ResponsesInList.Text: Oh, sorry, you are right! I missed that scenario, it was a long time ago when I did it Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scenarios for response codes on Moodle Mobile Additional Features plugin check.php
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan, Thanks for the confirmation. It's very helpful using that check.php as a diagnostic tool with the various response codes. Particularly in the case where there is a separate IT provider handling Moodle while we handle the mobile publishing. Much appreciated, Anthony

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodbile Android Client , new release and source code available
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there, we have released a new version of our Moodbile Android client, feturing user/password and Oauth authentication and: Webservice protocol JSON -RPC With OAuth Authentication. (included with moodbile server for Moodle 2.0 and Moodle 2.1) Offline mode The application can run without 3G/Wifi mobile connection. Persistent data storage of the contents already retrieved from the server using a database . Fast access to the contents of the local database using a memory cache. Refresh data and sincronizacion (under development). Moodle features Courses List the courses of the logged user and their contents/ activities sorted by course. The user can access to the modules/activities of his courses from the courses list. Forums List the course forums sorted by course. List the forum discussions of a selected forum. Create new discussions into a forum. List the discussion posts of a selected forum discussion. Reply a post. Update a post. Grades List the courses grade items sorted by course. Show an user grade item with his grade and the teacher's feedback. Users Show the logged user profile. List the participants of the user courses sorted by course. Show the user profile of a selected participant. Task Uploads, and access to resources  comming soon. You can get the app and the source code from the downloads page at moodbile.org

ResponsesInList.Title: Ang: Moodle for mobile devices
ResponsesInList.Text: Your Moodle should be available on all devises with access to the Internet via a browser. You might want to use a theme for mobiles though. ResponsesInList.Title: What are you doing with your autologout settings?
ResponsesInList.Text: We are planning to upgrade to Moodle 4.4 and I see that there are new autologout settings for the mobile app. I was wondering what other institutions are doing for these. We like the convenience of students not needing to reauthenticate often, but also see the privacy/security issue in never logging them out. We recently turned out biometric login in hopes that that will make the autologout easier on users. I also have one question about how this feature works which I can't answer from reading the setting and the mobile app documentation. Does the logout timer reset when a user returns to the app before it's elapsed? In other words, if we set it to one week, does that mean users login every week or only after a week-long absence? I think it's the latter but I'm not sure.

ResponsesInList.Title: What are you doing with your autologout settings?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Eric, As you said, autologout works very well when used with Biometric login, and, according to what we've seen, it is used in environments where strict security measures are in place because of the Moodle site content's sensitive level. Regarding your question, the answer will be after a week-long absence. The timer is set every time the user abandons the app and reset when the user returns. Regards, Juan

We provide a service where we can customise the app for anyone who needs it including the Push notifications (Airnotifier) service management. This service helps fund the improvement of the app in general: https://moodle.com/branded-app/ I’d recommend you to check the documentation links that are available in the Forum main page or hopefully somebody else in this forum will be able to help you. Cheers, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Airnotifier Installation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I installed the Airnotifier from the moodle2 branch of the following repository: https://github.com/moodlehq/airnotifier/tree/moodle2 I compiled and made the Android version of moodle app version 3.5.1. I defined the app on Google developer site, and set the API key, and project number inside Airnotifier. I created an access key in Airnotifier, and input the required information (Mobile app name, Airnotifier app name, Airnotifier URL , Airnotifier port, Airnotifier access key) in Moodle admin panel (plugins->Message outputs->Mobile). All thing seems to be OK, but in Airnotifier there is no device token registered. Please help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Airnotifier Installation
ResponsesInList.Text: Configuring local airnotifier is a big question in my mind yet.there isn't any community or documentation for this service and also no answer from here. but as we tried month ago we could succeed in creating a token with writing a php file if i remember correctly but after creating the token we couldn't find a way to give that token to a mobile device for example... in our side the "message sent" message was appeared but the other side is a question for us then we quit it please tell us too if you could find the answer

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Airnotifier Installation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Thank you very much for your information. As I found, after you start the mobile app for the first time, it receives the Airnotifier server information from Moodle site, and then registers its token with it. By calling airnotifier API it is easy to register a token manually, but this process must by automatic. Moodle app uses Adobe Phonegap push plugin to receive notifications. I think the problem might be due to restrictions to access Adobe sites due to sanctions. If this is true, you will be able to receive notifications with VPN. I checked it on my mobile phone, but there was no token registration yet.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Airnotifier Installation
ResponsesInList.Text: hi, yes exactly as you point making this process automaticly is the point. hope to find a solution

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Airnotifier Installation
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I found the solution. There is no need for VPN, and the Phonegap-plugin-push is working. The whole process is as follows: 1) After login on the mobile app, it registers its token as "pushid" on the moodle database in table mdl_user_devices. 2) When moodle site wants to send a notification to a user, it first registers all the user tokens (associated to his/her mobile phones) on the airnotifier, and then sends the notification.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Airnotifier Installation
ResponsesInList.Text: thanks alot can you give us a more detailed description from your first step til last? i mean after installing airnotifier

ResponsesInList.Title: Mobile App
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Support: I already enabled in Administration/Site Administration/Plugins/Web Service/ Mobile check box to allow me to connect via Moodle Mobile to our smartphone; but I couldn't save it; because is something wrong with the CSS certificate. Honestly I don't know what should i do in this part. Please, if someone can advise me in this section, I will appreciate. Regards. Nancy S. It is recommended to enable HTTPS with a valid certificate. The Moodle app will always try to use a secured connection first. CSS mobilecssurl Default: Empty A CSS file to customise your mobile app interface

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mobile App
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Nancy I think you have CSS and SSL certificates mixed up. CSS is used to style web applications like Moodle. The field you are using would allow you to customise the look and feel (like colors, font sizes etc) of your Moodle mobile app. SSL or secure socket layer certificates allow you to create a secure browser environment through the use of trusted Public/Private key pairs.  For more information please have a look here http://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/SSL You will need to purchase SSL certificates from a vendor like InstantSSL or Namecheap because they need to originate from a trusted party like Verisign or Comodo. What is it that you are trying to achieve? Regards Ravi

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mobile App
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Nancy, that information is just informative, you should be able to connect using the mobile app via HTTP Cheers, Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Activate account with OTP through mobile SMS
ResponsesInList.Text: To my responders, it's great to see such interest and support! I could definitely make better instructions on how to use this. I actually only recently got this plugin fully working, but then I ended up merging it with a much larger "Equipment" plugin I'm working on (which is also free and open source, though not finished yet). The big thing that kept me from making this plugin usable for my use-case was that I wanted users to be redirected to the phone verification page if their phone had not yet been verified, but this should not happen with every user; only with users assigned with the role of "Parent" to another user, i.e. their students. Parents need to verify their phones; students do not. Thinking long-term for my company, theoretically, parents could be students and students could be parents. Because of this possibility, I had to figure out how to differentiate different types of user accounts. I found one way, though it's not the best. Anyway, the plugin should actually still be working, but users must go to the phone verification page to verify their phones manually. My Equipment plugin may be worth checking out when it's done, but it's a big boy, and I'm only 1 person, so it'll have a good amount of flaws, and some dirty code.

ResponsesInList.Title: moodlEZ : The new Moodle mobile app for iPad
ResponsesInList.Text: PragmaTouch team is pleased to announce that our new application moodlEZ (MoodleEasy) is submitted to the Apple AppStore and is waiting for approval. We hope our new app will be available for purchase on the AppStore within couple of days. So stay tuned. If you want to learn more about moodlEZ please contac us . Endless thanks goes from PragmaTouch team to Robert Kelley the Technology Manager/Computer Science Teacher from Mount Airy Bible Church & Christian Academiy for his great ideas and testing efforts. Check out the screenshots Below is the Apple AppStore description  of moodlEZ MoodlEZ (MoodleEasy) is a specialized Moodle web browser app with file upload support. MoodleEZ also supports file downloads from your Moodle site to your device. MoodlEZ renders your Moodle site as is and provides you pop over hint when you hit a page which includes file uploads. MoodlEZ provides full support for Moodle 2.x modules and all roles (teacher, student and administrator) while we provide limited support to students for assignment, forums and glossary modules on Moodle 1.9.x. Some highlights of MoodlEZ - Browser your Moodle site as is - Upload files - Take photo or choose photo from album and upload - Pick files from other apps (Dropbox, Box.NET, QuickOffice and all apps with Document Support) and upload - Download files from any web site and upload to Moodle - Downloads files from Moodle and send to other apps (Dropbox, Box.NET, QuickOffice and all apps with Document Support) - Supports custom schemes (Mobicip Safe Browser and other browser with same functionality) and opens them with the registered app - Multiple site support; define profiles and access all your moodle sites easily - Remember address, username and password for multiple Moodle sites - Login to your moodle site with just two tocuhes Also do not forget to take a look at our mTouch and mTouch+ apps.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Participant pictures don't appear on My Moodle mobile app
ResponsesInList.Text: I’m following up from my previous post with the hopes someone will chime in regarding our inability to view participant profile pictures on My Moodle 1.1.1 mobile app on Moodle 2.3.1. Yes, I know the My Moodle is no longer supported but I think this issue is related more to the architecture of Moodle itself, and not directly to the mobile app. To confirm the problem isn’t the My Moodle, I enrolled in Moodle.org and I’m able to see participant pictures just fine using the mobile app. The picture feature on the mobile app is important because a new cohort is starting next week and linking pictures, bios and phone numbers is probably one of the most useful features of the mobile app as we begin our hybrid program and community building. I’ve searched various settings and preferences in Moodle 2.3.1 but nothing has worked.  I thought I found something via Site administration>Security>Site Policies>Force users to login to view user pictures - but changing this setting didn’t help. To help troubleshoot, I contacted a coder and asked his opinion regarding possible solutions.  He isn’t familiar with Moodle but he let me know that it is common for some platforms to create thumbnail files and scripts that function as pointers - but they often get misdirected or the pictures are incorrectly resized.  This sparked interest because the problem started when I batch imported user pictures via the administrative setting Users>Accounts> Upload user pictures (I used the username attribute and a .zip file with jpg images.)  The batch import automatically created .png files which work fine within the Web version of the Moodle, but not on the mobile app. Because I am still learning the various Moodle administrative roles I need help explaining the Moodle architecture to my local coder.  Where are the Participant Profile pictures actually stored?  Does the batch import method I describe above create pointer scripts and thumbnails?  If so, where can they be found on our server directory?  Would the mobile app have a different folder for these profile images?  Are there administrative settings within Moodle that allow me to manage these processes? Any help is appreciated!

ResponsesInList.Title: MM2 - How to enable addon for individual courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I'm implementing addon for Moodle Mobile 2 and I registered it using $mmCoursesDelegate.registerPlugin, so it's available from the list of the courses. It works fine, but I need to enable/disable it for the individual courses. If teacher did not activate my plugin on the regular Moodle web application for his course, it should not be available for that course in Mobile application too. I implemented external service that receives courseid and returns information if this plugin should be enabled or not for that course. However, I'm not sure how to implement this on the front end. Thanks, Zoran

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MM2 - How to enable addon for individual courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Zoran, You should be able to selectively disable a plugin by defining the method 'isEnabledForCourse()'. See https://github.com/moodlehq/moodlemobile2/blob/master/www/core/components/courses/services/delegate.js#L35 Cheers, Fred

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MM2 - How to enable addon for individual courses
Re: MM2 - How to enable addon for individual courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Zoran, as you say, the function passed to $mmCoursesDelegate.registerPlugin is not the place to check that, in there you only need to check if the plugin is available for the current site. This function is executed when a user logs in a site or the site data is updated. I see you have implemented the isEnabledForCourse function inside $mmaMorph, as the delegate doc says. This function is going to be called for each course, and the courseId is passed as a parameter: https://github.com/moodlehq/moodlemobile2/blob/master/www/core/components/courses/services/delegate.js#L80 So you don't need to manually call that function, it will be automatically called. Hope this helps! Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MM2 - How to enable addon for individual courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Thanks for explanation. It seems that support for this has been implemented recently, and I was using moodlemobile2 code which was 3-4 weeks old which didn't have that trigger. Once I updated to the recent code everything started to work fine. Thanks, Zoran

ResponsesInList.Title: iframes in the 3.5.2
ResponsesInList.Text: hi every one, as i saw in the 3.5.2 new features "Embedded content from the site in iframes now works in the app" now i have a question... in our site we have a code editor that cause of it's javascript base, can not be shown in mobile app. is it possible to use iframe to show it in mobile app too?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re:  iframes in the 3.5.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi behnaz, the only improvement we did was to support "auto-login" in some iframes. If any of those iframe points to the current site we try to authenticate the user first before loading the final page (this fixed an H5P issue). As I understand, that solution doesn't apply to your case. Cheers, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re:  iframes in the 3.5.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Dani, We're on 3.5.2 and latest app. I have some embedded H5P activities which work fine on desktop, but display "You do not have access to this content. Try logging in' in the mobile app. Am I to understand that this iss that how it should be, still - or am I missing some settings to get this working? I'm using the ATTO editor plugin which produces the following code: <iframe src="https://SERVER_ADDRESS_MASKED/develop/moodle/mod/hvp/embed.php?id=4383" class="filter_hvp" id="hvp_4383" style="width:100%; height:auto; border:0;" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe> <script src="https://SERVER_ADDRESS_MASKED/develop/moodle/mod/hvp/library/js/h5p-resizer.js" charset="UTF-8"></script> Many thanks in advance Gavin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re:  iframes in the 3.5.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Gavin, this issue was fixed for 3.5.2 version of the app (latest), but the solution has some limitations. We use auto-login to authenticate the user in the H5P activity (see this Moodle issue for more information). The requirements to make this work are: The site needs to use Moodle 3.2 or higher. The site needs to use https, not http. The user needs to have a private token. This is created when the user token is created (the user authenticates in the app). If the user authenticated in the app when your server was using a Moodle older than 3.2 you might need to invalidate all tokens to force them to re-create the token. You can see the private tokens in the database , table external_tokens, there is a privatetoken column. A user can only auto-login once every 6 minutes. Auto-login is usually triggered when an iframe pointing to the site is viewed in the app (your case) or when the app opens a URL pointing to the site in the browser of the device. Please notice that the session in an iframe is usually kept for a while unless the user restarts the app, this means that if the user views the H5P and it works he'll be able to view it again without triggering the auto-login if he doesn't restart the app. Cheers, Dani

ResponsesInList.Title: Re:  iframes in the 3.5.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Dani, Really helpful - thanks very much. Gavin

ResponsesInList.Title: Request: document steps to build desktop version of Moodle Mobile
ResponsesInList.Text: We are using Moodle Mobile internally and would like to evaluate Moodle Desktop, too, however our internal policy essentially "encourages" us to compile software ourselves if it's open source (it's more complicated actually, but I'll spare you the details). We tried to build a Windows version of Moodle Mobile using the "windows" platform of Cordova (which only works for 10, and to a lesser degree for 8, and not for 7), and the generated Visual Studio templates, however run into the usual ydn-db DataError due to the web view used, right after logging in. The Moodle Mobile desktop app does not produce that error, so I am guessing that a different approach is used here. Are there any additional patches required for building Moodle Desktop that did not make it to the repository, or are there any pointers or build scripts that you could share? I'd of course be more than happy to properly document all necessary steps if we manage to get it working.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Request: document steps to build desktop version of Moodle Mobile
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Moodle Desktop is built using Electron (not the Cordova windows platform), please read https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Moodle_Desktop Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Request: document steps to build desktop version of Moodle Mobile
ResponsesInList.Text: thank you! That much I knew, but is there more than "ionic build browser", and then setting up a minimal Electron app that points to index.html?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Request: document steps to build desktop version of Moodle Mobile
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Electron and ionic are not related at all, "ionic build browser" will do nothing. Unfortunately, we don't have resources for publishing a detailed guide for building desktop apps with Electron. Please, refer to the Electron documentation linked from this document: https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Moodle_Desktop

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Request: document steps to build desktop version of Moodle Mobile
ResponsesInList.Text: sorry for bothering you again, but I thought one of the standard approaches to transform a Cordova/Ionic app to an Electron app was to build for the "browser" platorm in Cordova, and then create a thin boilerplate Electron app essentially pointing to the index.html file generated in the previous step. Is the approach you are taking that much different?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Request: document steps to build desktop version of Moodle Mobile
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, our approach was different because Cordova browser support is very limited and we had to re-implement some Cordova APIs to support an Electron backend.

ResponsesInList.Title: This forum post has been removed
ResponsesInList.Text: The content of this forum post has been removed and can no longer be accessed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: h.264 problem
ResponsesInList.Text: Through which player are you trying to deliver the content? h.264 is just a video format. To show that content on a webpage, you still need to deliver it via a player. And if the player is Flash, well then there's your reason why it won't show on an iDevice. You might want to try running your h.264-encoded video through the QuickTime browser plugin. Search around on the web for QuickTime <object/embed> techniques. You might find some helpful info here: http://www.apple.com/quicktime/tutorials/embed.html

ResponsesInList.Title: This forum post has been removed
ResponsesInList.Text: The content of this forum post has been removed and can no longer be accessed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: h.264 problem
ResponsesInList.Text: When you enable the .mov recognition in media filter it also turns on detection for files with mp4, m4v and m4a suffixes. It rewrites an mov, m4v, or mp4 link into some markup to load the video using quicktime plugin using an object tag. This works for me using moodle using safari on iphone. But only on suitably sized video files, which are 640x480 or smaller. It looks like mobile safari on ipod / iphone inspects the actual video file to determine if it is playable, and whether it is playable appears to depend on resolution and filetype. It may also depend on bitrate and network connection type - whether the device is connected via wifi, 3g or 2g phone network. Watch on iphone - when it is given an html5 <video> tag or a quicktime <object> tag, a quicktime placeholder appears, and then a short time later either the play icon or unplayable icon appears in the centre of the video placeholder.
